translation:
adj. 疯狂的; 猛烈的; 着迷的; 〔口语〕愤怒的，生气的
vt. 使疯狂

级别：madder, maddest
分布：生气的(38%)，着迷的(28%)，狂热的(21%)，鲁莽的(9%)，极度激动的(4%)


→来自Proto-Germanic*maid,变坏，恶化，来自mei,改变，词源同mutual,miss.后引申词义心理失常的，发疯的。
a.发疯的;狂热的,着迷的;恼火的,生气的You mad madam, my dad doesn't like the bad badminton pad.你这个疯太太,我爸爸不喜欢这种坏羽毛球垫.



[mæd] (madder or maddest)adjective MENTALLY ILL  有精神疾病的   ESSENTIAL  offensive ■mentally ill, or unable to behave in a reasonable way; insane  疯的，神经错乱的，精神失常的
•I think I must be going mad.我想我肯定要疯了。

•Do I look like some mad old woman in this hat?我戴上这顶帽子看上去像个疯老太婆吗？
⇒ See also madhouse;madman
[mæd] (madder or maddest)adjective SILLY  愚蠢的   IMPROVER  mainly UK informal ■extremely silly or stupid; crazy  极其愚笨的；发疯的
•[+ to infinitive] You're mad to walk home alone at this time of night.你发疯了，晚上这个时候独自一人走回家。

•He must be mad spending all that money on a coat.他一定是疯了，花那么多钱买一件外套。

•Some of the things she does are completely mad.她做的一些事情极其愚蠢。
⇒ See also madcap
[mæd] (madder or maddest)adjective ANGRY  生气的   ADVANCED  [after verb] informal ■very angry or annoyed 非常愤怒的，狂怒的；十分恼火的
•He's always complaining and it makes me so mad.他没完没了地抱怨，令我十分恼火。

•mainly US Are you still mad at me?你还在生我的气吗？

•mainly UK Kerry got really mad with Richard for not doing the washing up.理查没有洗碗，克丽大发雷霆。

•Bill's untidiness drives me mad.比尔的邋遢真让我受不了。

[mæd] (madder or maddest)adjective HURRYING  匆忙的  [before noun]  hurrying or excited and not having time to think or plan 发疯似的；忙乱的
•We made a mad dash for the train.我们发疯似的赶火车。

•I was in a mad panic/rush trying to get everything ready.我发疯似的急急忙忙想把一切准备好。

[mæd] (madder or maddest)adjective ENTHUSIASTIC  热情的  be mad about sb/sth informal ■to love someone or something 喜爱，对…着迷
•He's the first real boyfriend she's had and she's mad about him.他是她第一个真正的男朋友，她很迷恋他。

•He's mad about football.他对足球着迷。
be mad for sb/sth UK informal ■to want someone or something very much, or to be very interested in them 极想要；对…极感兴趣
•Everyone's mad for him and I just don't see the attraction.大家都为他倾倒，可我就没看出他哪里有吸引力。

[mæd] (madder or maddest)adjective (as) mad as a hatter / March hare ■extremely silly or stupid 非常愚蠢的
[mæd] (madder or maddest)adjective Don't get mad, get even. ■something that you say in order to tell someone not to be angry when someone has upset them, but to do something that will upset them as much 别激动，报复吧！（告诉别人与其为人困扰，不如以牙还牙）
•This is my advice to wives whose husbands have left them for a younger woman - don't get mad, get even!这是我对丈夫另觅年轻新欢而遭到抛弃的妻子的忠告－－别激动，你就以其人之道还诸其身吧！

[mæd] (madder or maddest)adjective like mad informal ■If you do something like mad, you do it very enthusiastically, quickly or a lot 疯狂地；拚命地；极快地
•She's been saving like mad because she wants to buy a car.她想买汽车，所以在拚命存钱。





mad, crazy, mental

这组词都有“发疯的，精神错乱的”的意思，其区别是：
mad: 语气比crazy正式，但系普通用词。通常指人精神狂乱，完全不能自我控制的一种病态。
crazy: 通俗用词，指极度的神经错乱或精神失常，也指对事物的狂势，失去自控能力。
mental: 通常指患有精神病的。



angry, indignant, mad

这些形容词均有“发怒的，愤怒的”之意。
angry: 侧重以愤怒的表情、激烈的言辞或威胁的目光等来表达感情。
indignant: 侧重愤怒是有充分理由和正当的。
mad: 多用于非正式文体和讲话中，与angry意义相近。


adj. 疯狂的；发疯的；愚蠢的；着迷的
 - crazy, possessed, foolish, stupid, bugs
n. 狂怒
 - fury, agriothymia
examples: 英 [mæd] 美 [mæd]
adj.发疯的，发狂似的；狂热的；鲁莽的；着迷的；生气的；极度激动的

(1) She was almost mad with grief when her son died.(2) They are mad about football.(3) It was a mad idea to climb the mountain in this bad weather.(4) Both brothers are mad about tennis.(5) When Bob gets mad, you can't hold him down.(6) I was so mad at getting this kind of bum rap.
(1) 她的儿子死去时，她悲伤得几乎疯了。(2) 他们对足球很狂热。(3) 在这种坏天气去爬山真是愚蠢。(4) 兄弟俩对网球都很入迷。(5) 当鲍勃生气的时候，你都抑制不住他。(6) 受这样的冤枉气真让我非常生气。”
[sound:youdao-ea1db363-419de6f7-0b22a3b3-ec6ab457-deeb979f.mp3]

translation:
n. 女士; 小姐; 喜欢指使他人的年轻妇女; （妓院的）鸨母

分布：夫人(53%)，女士(31%)，太太(16%)


→来自古法语ma dame,即my lady.后用于对已婚女士的尊称。



noun WOMAN  妇女   ADVANCED  (ALSO usually Madam) only singular ■a formal and polite way of speaking to a woman （对妇女正式而礼貌的称呼）夫人，太太，女士
•[as form of address] May I carry your cases for you, Madam?需要帮您提箱子吗，夫人？
Dear Madam  ADVANCED  ■the usual way of beginning a formal letter to a woman whose name you do not know （正式信函开头对未知姓名的妇女的尊称）尊敬的女士only singular disapproving ■a young girl who behaves like an older woman, expecting others to obey her 小妇人，喜欢使唤他人的年轻女孩
•She's turning into a proper little madam.她正在变成一个十足的小妇人。

['mæd.əm] noun SEX  性  countable ■a woman who is in charge of a group of prostitutes who live or work in the same house （妓院的）鸨母，老鸨




madam, lady, mrs, miss

这些名词均表示对女性的尊称。
madam: 夫人、太太，女士，小姐。与尊称男人的用词sir相对，多用于对已婚或未婚妇女的礼貌称呼，如店员对女顾客的称呼，后面不加姓名。如果已知对方的身份或姓名可在此词后面加上姓名职位。
lady: 女士，夫人，与gentleman相对，是对女性的礼貌称呼，多用于演讲或祝酒时称呼在场的女性。
mrs: 太太，夫人，是mistress的缩略形式，对已婚妇女的称呼。
miss: 小姐，是对未婚或不知婚姻状况的女性的称呼，与姓氏连用时应大写。


n. 夫人；女士；鸨母
 - Mrs, Miss, wife
examples: 英 ['mædəm] 美 ['mædəm]
n.夫人；女士；太太

(1) This way please, madam.(2) That poor madam has lost all contact with reality.(3) Madam Curie is a French professor of physics .(4) She's a real little madam!(5) Our manager will be up in a minute, madam.(6) Will you have your eggs turned over madam?(7) We are open 24 hours a day, madam.
(1) 这边请，夫人。(2) 那位可怜的夫人脱离了现实生活。(3) 居里夫人是一位法国物理学教授。(4) 她是个十足的小姐！(5) 我们的经理将马上到，女士。(6) 太太，您的蛋要两面煎吗?(7) 我们24小时营业，太太。
[sound:youdao-3101b6b4-80c482c1-76e306b7-b72b3b4e-850fbb11.mp3]

translation:
n. 弹药库; 杂志; 弹仓; 胶卷盒

分布：杂志(96%)，弹药库(3%)，弹盘(1%)


→来自阿拉伯语makhzan,仓库，ma-,地名前缀，词源同mosque,khazana,存储。在16世纪进入英语后，该词原义也为仓库，特指军火库。后在1731年，一本杂志取名为”Gentleman’s Magazin”,字面意思即绅士的仓库，绅士信息指南。随着该杂志的流行，使该词引申词义杂志，期刊，并成为主要词义。比较arsenal.
n.杂志,期刊The submitted submarine on the magic magazine is shining and magnificent.魔术杂志上那艘提交的潜艇闪亮而壮观.



noun countable BOOK  书   ESSENTIAL  (informal mag) ■a type of thin book with large pages and a paper cover which contains articles and photographs and is published every week or month 杂志，期刊
•She has written articles for several women's magazines.她为几家女性杂志撰稿。

•a glossy magazine用亮光纸印刷的杂志

•men's mags男性杂志

•a magazine rack杂志架

[ˌmæg.ə'zi:n] noun countable GUN PART  枪的部件  ■a part of a gun in which cartridges are stored, or a building in which explosives, weapons and supplies are kept （枪的）弹仓，弹盒；军火库，军械库




journal, magazine, press, periodical, review, newspaper, publication

这组词都有“出版物或定期刊物”的意思，其区别是：
journal: 本义为“日报”，现在可指定期发生的周刊、月刊、季刊等或指学术团体出版的刊物、杂志或学报。
magazine: 指刊登各种文章、小说、诗歌、评议的杂志。
press: 系报刊总称，也指报界或报业。
periodical: 通常指除日报以外的定期出版刊物。
review: 多指登载评论性文章或讨论重大事件的文章的刊物。
newspaper: 一般指每日出版的报纸。
publication: 指出版物，发行物。


n. 杂志；弹药库；胶卷盒
 - journal, mags
examples: 英 [ˌmæɡə'ziːn] 美 ['mæɡəziːn]
n.杂志；弹盘；弹药库

(1) This magazine has a large circulation.(2) I was reading a magazine when the phone rang.(3) This magazine comes out quarterly.(4) Lieutenant Hearn fingered the magazine on his carbine.(5) A lot of damage was caused when the magazine exploded.
(1) 这本杂志发行量很大。(2) 电话铃响时我正在看一本杂志。(3) 这种杂志一年发行四期。(4) 候恩少尉用手摸了一下卡宾枪的弹盒。(5) 弹药库爆炸时造成很大损失。
[sound:youdao-d91b3faf-f269565b-558457bb-a461d91a-11c97d8d.mp3]

translation:
n. 磁铁，磁石; 有吸引力的人或物; [物]磁体

分布：磁铁(100%)


→来自拉丁语magnetum,磁石，来自希腊语Magnes lithos,即来自Magnesia的石头，lithos,石头，词源同lithology.Magnesia为古希腊地名，来自当地人的族名Magnetes.因石头中发现天然磁石而得名。比较magnesia.
n.磁体,磁铁Beijing is a magnet for tourists.北京是吸引游客的地方.



noun countable OBJECT  物体  ■an object that is able both to attract iron and steel objects and also push them away 磁体；磁铁，磁石
['mæg.nət] noun countable ATTRACTION  吸引  ■a person, place or thing that other people feel strongly attracted to 有吸引力的人（或地方、物）
•The United States has always acted as a magnet for people seeking fame and fortune.美国一直像磁石般吸引着追名逐利的人。




n. [材] 磁铁；磁体； [电磁] 磁石
 - aimant, leading stone
examples: 英 ['mæɡnət] 美 ['mæɡnət]
n.磁铁；有吸引力的人（物）
(1) He picked all the pins up with a magnet.(2) He was deeply attracted by the delicate cast of her features.(3) Forbidden City is a great magnet for foreign tourists.
(1) 他用磁铁捡起了所有的大头针。(2) 他的前途取决于这一机会。(3) 紫禁城对外国旅游者来说是个有巨大吸引力的地方。
[sound:youdao-1780777b-ba0bd912-2003b83d-c78758cb-f42d15f1.mp3]

translation:
adj. 有磁性的，有吸引力的; 磁性的; 有吸引力的; 有魅力的

分布：有吸引力的(51%)，有磁性的(43%)，催眠术的(6%)


a.磁的,有磁性的;有吸引力的He has magnetic personality.他有吸引人的个性.
【记】来自magnet（n 吸铁石）



US [-'netˌ-] adjective OBJECT  物件  ■with the power of a magnet 磁的，有磁性的；磁化的
UK [mæg'net.ɪk] US [-'netˌ-] adjective ATTRACTIVE  吸引的  ■describes someone whose personality attracts a lot of people 有吸引力的，有魅力的



adj. 地磁的；有磁性的；有吸引力的
 - geomagnetic
examples: 英 [mæɡ'netɪk] 美 [mæɡ'netɪk]
adj.有磁性的；有吸引力的；催眠术的n.磁体，磁性物质
(1) The loop becomes magnetic when the current is switched on.(2) She has a magnetic personality.(3) She was the most magnetic speaker I have ever listened to.
(1) 通电时线圈就会有磁性。(2) 她具有极具吸引力的性格。(3) 她是我所听过的演讲者中最有吸引力的一位。

translation:
adj. 壮丽的; 伟大的，高尚的; 华丽的，高贵的; 瑰丽的

分布：宏伟的(50%)，壮丽的(42%)，极好的(8%)


→magni-,巨大的，-fic,做，制造。引申词义伟大，壮观，辉煌。
a.华丽的,高尚的,宏伟的The submitted submarine on the magic magazine is shining and magnificent.魔术杂志上那艘提交的潜艇闪亮而壮观.
【记】mag大，nificent－大的建筑物－宏伟的【反】base（adj 卑鄙的；低级的）



adjective  ADVANCED  ■very good, beautiful or deserving to be admired 极好的；壮丽的；令人羡慕的
•a magnificent view壮丽的景色

•a magnificent piece of writing文笔出众的杰作

•They live in a magnificent Tudor house.他们住在一座都铎时代的豪宅内。





magnificent, gorgeous, glorious, superb, splendid

这组词都有“华丽的，宏传的，辉煌的”的意思，其区别是：
magnificent: 侧重指建筑物、宝石等的华丽堂皇。
gorgeous: 指色彩的富丽和豪华，有时含炫耀和卖弄意味。
glorious: 指光芒四射的绚丽，也指值得称倾、赞美或扬名的壮丽辉煌。
superb: 指壮丽辉煌、宏伟等的极点。
splendid: 侧重指给观察者留下壮丽辉煌或灿烂夺目的印象。



magnificent, grand, majestic, splendid, noble

这组词都有“宏伟壮丽的”的意思，其区别是：
magnificent: 指环境、建筑物等本身的壮丽、堂皇、庄严、崇高或出色等。
grand: 侧重规模大，豪华而宏伟壮丽、盛大。也可指人的崇高、伟大。
majestic: 侧重状态、外表、仪态等给人以威严感。
splendid: 指人在行为、品德或性格等方面的卓越超群；指物侧重外观上的辉煌。用于口语中，作“极好的，绝妙的”解。
noble: 指因本身著名或从外表上看有令人难忘的华丽、庄严、卓越、雄壮或崇高。


adj. 高尚的；壮丽的；华丽的；宏伟的
 - grand, noble, brave
examples: 英 [mæɡ'nɪfɪsnt] 美 [mæɡ'nɪfɪsnt]
adj.壮丽的；宏伟的；极好的

(1) The magnificent sights collect a jolly crowd.(2) The Hungarian view is magnificent from the summit of the mountains.(3) Just look at this magnificent autumn landscape!(4) The Taj Mahal is a magnificent building.(5) The museum that we visited is very magnificent .(6) The king lived in this magnificent palace.(7) The celebrations provided a magnificent spectacle.(8) These magnificent palaces impressed the foreigners deeply.(9) The Parthenon is a magnificent structure.(10) The magnificent goal spurred the team on to victory.(11) What a magnificent future!

(1) 壮丽的景色引来欢乐的人群。(2) 从群山之颠看到的匈牙利景色非常壮丽。(3) 看看这壮丽的秋景吧！(4) 泰姬陵是一座宏伟的建筑。(5) 我们参观的博物馆是很宏伟的。(6) 国王住在这座宏伟的宫殿里。(7) 庆祝活动呈现一派宏伟的景象。(8) 这些宏伟的宫殿给外宾们留下了深刻的印象。(9) 帕台农神庙是一座宏伟的建筑物。(10) 他们那一球进得漂亮，鼓舞了全队的士气夺取胜利。(11) 多么美好的未来啊！
[sound:youdao-8def68ea-742713b0-cfb39275-f1df4885-b07e5e36.mp3]

translation:
n. 女仆，侍女; 少女; 处女，未婚女子

分布：侍女(100%)


→缩写自maiden.
n.少女,处女,女仆A maid in a white apron opened the door for me.一个身着白围裙的女佣帮我开了门.



noun countable SERVANT  仆人  ■a woman who works as a servant in a hotel or in someone's home （饭店的）女服务员；（家中的）女佣，女仆，侍女
•In the beach resort, the apartments and villas have daily maid service.海滩渡假胜地的公寓和别墅里每天都有女佣打扫。

•In California many illegal immigrants work as maids, nannies and gardeners.在加利福尼亚州，许多非法移民当女佣、保姆和园丁。

[meɪd] noun countable GIRL  女孩  old use■a girl or young woman who is not married, or has not had sex 女孩，少女，（未婚的）年轻女子




girl, daughter, maid, maiden

这组词都有“姑娘，女孩子”的意思，其区别是：
girl: 指7岁到12岁左右的女孩，与boy相对，广义指未婚的女孩。
daughter: 指女子对父母而言的概称，不涉及年龄的大小。
maid: 指闺女，女佣人。
maiden: 指少女，处女或未婚女子。


n. 女仆；少女
 - servant girl, jill
vt. 侍候；做新娘的女傧相
 - wait upon, attend on
examples: 英 [meɪd] 美 [meɪd]
n.【C】女仆；侍女n.【古】未婚女子

(1) Her maid helped her to dress up for the party.(2) I'll send the maid round to carry it to your house.(3) The maid lowered her chin and simpered.(4) They have two servants, a cook and a maid.(5) Maids want nothing but husbands, and when they have them, they want everything.
(1) 她的女仆帮助她穿上参加晚会的礼服。(2) 我将派女仆把它送到你家去。(3) 那位侍女压低下额傻笑着。(4) 他们有两个仆人，一个厨子和一个侍女。(5) 待嫁女子除了丈夫以外什么都不想要,可是,当她们有了丈夫之后,什么都想要了。
[sound:youdao-ca6f9879-ae960e8f-d4df89da-ccacd5c0-916d2e47.mp3]

translation:
n. 邮件，邮政; 邮政（制度）; 邮务员，邮递员; 〈古〉袋，旅行包
vt. 邮寄; 给…穿盔甲
vi. 投邮

时态：mailed, mailing, mails
分布：邮件(76%)，邮寄(16%)，邮政(8%)


→来自Proto-Germanic*malho,来自molko,皮袋，袋子。后引申词义旅行袋，信件袋，邮袋，最终用于指邮件。mail 锁子甲
n.邮件v.邮寄The sailor was nailed on the rail for he failed to trail the mail.水手被钉在横木上,因为他未能跟踪邮件.



noun POST  邮件   ESSENTIAL  [S or U] (mainly UK post) ■the letters and parcels which are sent by post, or the postal system itself 邮件，信件；邮包；邮政（系统）
•She spent the morning reading and answering her mail.她花了一个上午处理信件。

•All of our customers will be contacted by mail.我们利用邮件方式联络所有的客户。

•The book came in yesterday's mail.书是昨天寄达的。

•Some strange things get sent through the mail.一些奇怪的东西经邮政系统寄了出去。

[meɪl] noun COVERING  覆盖物  uncountable ■chain mail 
[meɪl] verb transitive mainly US (mainly UK post) ■to send a letter or parcel or email something 邮寄；把…寄出
•She mailed it last week but it still hasn't arrived.上周她就把它寄出了，但还没有寄达。

•[+ two objects] I promised to mail him the article/mail the article to him.我答应过把文章寄给他。





mail, post

这组词都有“邮件，邮寄”的意思，其区别是：
mail: 主要用于美国。
post: 主要用于英国。


n. 邮件；邮政， [邮] 邮递；盔甲
 - armour, dawk
vi. 邮寄；寄出
 - send off, pack off
examples: 英 [meɪl] 美 [meɪl]
n.邮件；邮政vt.邮寄

(1) I opened my mail and was surprised to see a broken vase.(2) Some mail came for you this morning.(3) Our products are available by mail order.(4) This mail service is called Rural Free Delivery.(5) I went to the post office to mail the letters.(6) Make sure the parcel is tied up before you mail it.
(1) 我打开了邮件，惊讶地发现了一个打碎的花瓶。(2) 今天上午有你的邮件。(3) 我们的产品可用邮政划拨。(4) 这种邮政服务称为'农村免费邮递服务'。(5) 我去邮局寄信。(6) 包裹在邮寄前一定要捆好。
[sound:youdao-d21ca66a-6d00efd3-7d5f83e0-cfb20b2f-89c19e78.mp3]

translation:
adj. 主要的，最重要的; 全力的
n. 最主要的部分，重点; 主要管道; 体力; [航海]公海

分布：主要的(77%)，最重要的(11%)，总管道(6%)，干线(6%)


→来自古英语maegen,能力，力量，强壮，来自magh,使有能力，赋予力量，词源同machine,magic,might.引申词义主要的，最重要的。原词义见短语might and main,尽全力。拼写比较dainty,fain,rain.
a.主要的,总的n.总管道;干线After maintenance the main remains and remainders are left on the domain.维修之后,主要遗骸和剩余物留在了领地上.



adjective [before noun]  ESSENTIAL  ■larger, more important, or having more influence than others of the same type 主要的；最重要的；最大的
•The main thing is not to worry.最重要的是不要忧虑。

•One of the main reasons I came to England was to study the language.我到英格兰的主要原因之一是学习语言。

•You'll find the main points of my proposal in the report.你们可以在这份报告中看到我计划的要点。

•Our main aim/objective is to improve the company's productivity.我们的主要目的是提高公司的生产力。

•The main problem in the health service is lack of resources.公共医疗卫生服务的主要问题是缺乏资金。

•My main concern about moving to London is the cost of housing.我对移居伦敦的主要忧虑是房价太高。

[meɪn] adjective [before noun] be sb's main squeeze US informal ■to be the person that someone has a romantic or sexual relationship with 是某人的情人
[meɪn] noun PIPE  管道  countable ■a large pipe which carries water or gas, or a wire carrying electricity, from one place to another, to which a house can be connected （输送水、煤气的）主管道，总管；（输送电力的）干线
•a gas main煤气总管

•The severe cold caused a water main to burst and flood the street.严寒导致总水管爆裂，街道被淹。
mains [plural] UK ■the system of pipes or wires which carry water or electricity into a house, or the pipes which carry sewage away from a house （输送水、电的）管道系统；下水道系统
•The house isn't on the mains.这座房子尚未接上管道系统。

•They bought a house with no mains supply.他们买了一座没有接上水电的房子。

•mains electricity供电系统的电力
the mains UK ■the place at which outside pipes or wires carrying water, electricity, etc. connect with the system inside a house or building 内外管道相接处；总阀门；总电源
•Switch off the electricity at the mains before starting work.工作前要先关闭总电源。

[meɪn] noun MOSTLY  主要地  in the main ■generally or mostly 大体上；基本上
•Her friends are teachers in the main.她的朋友基本上都是老师。





principal, leading, primary, foremost, capital, major, chief, main

这组词都有“首要的，主要的”的意思，其区别是：
principal: 用于人时，指地位优于其他人；用于物时，指该物在大小、重要性等方面优于他物。
leading: 侧重指具有影响力或凝聚力。从而有主导和引导的作用。
primary: 通常不用于人。用于物时，指在重要性方面占第一位。
foremost: 侧重指在行进或发展过程中居首位。
capital: 着重指因重要性、意义、优越或重大而名列同类之首。
major: 指同其他人或其它物、问题等相比较，显得更加重要和突出。
chief: 拽人时，表同类中职位最高，权力最大；指物时，表同类中最重要，价值最高。
main: 通常只用于物。指在一定范围内，某物的重要性、体积或力量等超过其它物。


n. 主要部分，要点；体力； [材] 总管道
 - core, body, chief, heart, essential
adj. 主要的，最重要的；全力的
 - primary, major, central, ruling, great
examples: 英 [meɪn] 美 [meɪn]
adj.主要的；最重要的n.干线；总管道；[pl](水、煤、电)供应系统；大海

(1) The teacher asked me to note down the main points of the speech.(2) The speech was most disappointing,it skirted round all the main questions.(3) By defeating their main competitor this firm has cornered the wheat market.(4) The main road was flooded so we had to go round by narrow country lanes.(5) The main of their investments was lost in the war.(6) Is that the street that runs parallel to the main?(7) I turned the gas off at the mains before I went out.(8) When the water pipe burst she had the intelligence to turn off the water at the main.(9) My new house is not yet connected to the mains.

(1) 老师要求我把演说的要点记下来。(2) 这篇演讲非常令人失望,它回避了所有主要的问题。(3) 这家公司击败了主要的竞争对手而垄断了整个小麦市场。(4) 公路干线遭水淹没，我们只得择乡间小径绕行。(5) 他们的大部分投资在战争中损失了。(6) 是那条与主街道平行的街道吗?(7) 我出门之前，把煤气的总阀关掉了。(8) 水管裂开时,她很有头脑,连忙把总水门关上了。(9) 我的新房子还没接上水、 电、 煤气呢。
[sound:youdao-4de4f7bc-f67eccb3-8b197d00-f68eba41-a715a16d.mp3]

translation:
adv. 大部分地; 主要地; 基本上

分布：主要地(60%)，大部分地(40%)


adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■usually or to a large degree 通常地；主要地；大部分地
•I mainly go to bed around midnight.我通常在午夜前后去睡觉。

•The group is made up of mainly young people.该团体主要由年轻人组成。

•They argued that the tax will mainly benefit the rich.他们争辩说这项税收将主要让富人受益。





principally, mainly, generally, largely, chiefly, primarily, mostly, greatly

这组词都有“主要地，大量地”的意思，其区别是：
principally: 侧重居首要地位。
mainly: 指主要部分，突出在一系列事物中的相对重要性。
generally: 通常强调普遍性。
largely: 着重范围或分量大大超过别的成分。
chiefly: 侧重某人或某物在众多的人或物中占主要和显著地位。
primarily: 侧重基本地，首要地。
mostly: 强调数量占多半，近乎全部。
greatly: 通常强调程度的高。


adv. 主要地，大体上
 - basically, mostly, largely, primarily, chief
examples: 英 ['meɪnli] 美 ['meɪnli]
adv.主要地；大部分地

(1) Oats mainly grow in cool climate.(2) Weasel lives mainly on rats and rabbits.(3) The story is based mainly on tradition.(4) A banana is mainly pulp, except for its skin.(5) His money comes mainly from salary.(6) People in this shop are mainly tourists.
(1) 燕麦主要生长在气候凉爽的地区。(2) 黄鼠狼主要以老鼠和兔子为食。(3) 这故事主要来自传说。(4) 香蕉除了果皮之外，主要是果肉。(5) 他的钱主要来自工资。(6) 这家商店里的人们大都是游客。
[sound:youdao-dac89a15-adbffbc3-510ba7a5-80e0b252-20f259d3.mp3]

translation:
n. 大陆; 本土
adj. 大陆的; 本土的

分布：大陆(94%)，本土(6%)


n.大陆,本土The landlord's land on the highland of the mainland expanded a lot.地主在大陆高原上的土地扩张了很多.



N-SING（指与周围岛屿相对的）大陆，本土You can refer to the largest part of a country or continent as the mainland when contrasting it with the islands around it.例：She was going to Nanaimo to catch the ferry to the mainland.她准备去纳奈莫乘渡船回大陆。例：...the islands that lie off the coast of mainland Britain.远离英国本土的岛屿



n. [地理] 大陆；本土
 - continent, landmass
adj. [地理] 大陆的；本土的
 - continental, indigenous
examples: 英 ['meɪnlænd] 美 ['meɪnlænd]
n.大陆；本土

(1) The programs will be beamed to Mainland China.(2) The island is joined to the mainland by a bridge.(3) Bombay is linked to the mainland by a causeway.(4) Hawaii and Alaska are not on the mainland of the United States.
(1) 这些节目将对中国大陆播放。(2) 岛上有座桥与大陆相连。(3) 孟买和印度本土是由一条堤道相连的。(4) 夏威夷和阿拉斯加不在美国本土。
[sound:youdao-feb755a2-f7f46e9c-d857899b-fea0df63-ca8089c0.mp3]

translation:
vt. 保持; 保养; 坚持; 固执己见

时态：maintained, maintaining, maintains
分布：维持(62%)，维修(16%)，坚持(10%)，保养(10%)，断言(2%)


→来自古法语maintenir,保持，维持，来自拉丁语manu tenere,握在手上，控制，来自manu,手，词源同manual,tenere,握住，词源同tenure,contain.引申多种词义。
保持,维持(main[=man手]+tain拿→用手拿住→保持)[man,maun=hand,表示"手"]
维持;坚持(main[=man手]+tain→用手拿住→坚持)[tain,ten,tin=hold表示"拿住"]
维持(main+tain拿→拿住,留住→维持)[man,main=stay,表示"逗留"]
v.维修,保养,维持,供养,坚持,主张,支持His aunt maintained him at the university.他的姑母供他读大学.
【反】swerve（v 突然转向）－maintain direction



verb transitive CONTINUE TO HAVE  继续有   ESSENTIAL  ■to continue to have; to keep in existence, or not allow to become less 维持；保持
•The army has been brought in to maintain order in the region.军队已调配到这个地区来维持秩序。

•We have standards to maintain.我们要坚持原则。

•Despite living in different countries, the two families have maintained close links.尽管住在不同的国家，两个家庭仍保持着紧密联系。

•The film has maintained its position as the critics' favourite for another year.这部电影再度获评论家评为年度最佳影片。

[meɪn'teɪn] verb transitive KEEP IN GOOD CONDITION  保养   ADVANCED  ■to keep a road, machine, building, etc. in good condition 维修；保养
•A large house costs a lot to maintain.保养一座大房子花费很高。

•The roads around the town have been very poorly maintained.城镇四周的道路保养得很差。

[meɪn'teɪn] verb transitive EXPRESS  表达   ADVANCED  ■to express firmly your belief that something is true 坚称；断言
•Throughout his prison sentence Dunn has always maintained his innocence.邓恩在监狱服刑期间一直坚称自己是无辜的。

•[+ that] He maintains that he has never seen the woman before.他坚称以前从未见过那位妇女。

[meɪn'teɪn] verb transitive PROVIDE  提供  ■to provide someone with food and whatever is necessary for them to live on 供养；抚养；赡养
•They barely earn enough to maintain themselves and their four children.他们赚的钱只够勉强养活自己和四个孩子。





conserve, store, save, maintain, preserve

这组词都有“保存，储藏”的意思，其区别是：
conserve: 较正式用词，指小心地使用难以补充的资源或贵重物，免遭浪费或毁坏，以备不时之需。
store: 普通用词，指将物品存放，以备将来使用。
save: 普通用词，指尽量少用，以争取数量上有所增加。
maintain: 指保持原样，不增不减
preserve: 侧重将物品完好无损地保存下来。



allege, testify, affirm, maintain, assert, claim

这组词都有“断言，声称”的意思，其区别是：
allege: 多指无真凭实据，不提供证据的断言或宣称。
testify: 多指在法庭作证，庄严地宣称自己所说属实。
affirm: 侧重在作出断言时表现出的坚定与不可动摇的态度。
maintain: 与assert近义，但前者指坚决维护某种主张或观点。
assert: 主观意味强，指自认为某事就是如此，而不管事实如何。
claim: 可与assert换用，但语气弱一些，侧重指行为自己的权利提出要求他人承认。


vt. 维持；继续；维修；主张；供养
 - pursue, submit, sustain, advocate, service
examples: 英 [meɪn'teɪn] 美 [meɪn'teɪn]
vt.维持；维修；保养；坚持；断言

(1) It is absolutely vital that food supplies should be maintained.(2) They also help us to maintain the machinery.(3) They tell the peasants in detail how to maintain the pumps.(4) He maintains that there are no short cuts to effective management.
(1) 维持食物的供给是绝对必要的。(2) 他们还帮助我们维修机器。(3) 他们详细地教给农民怎样保养抽水机。(4) 他断言,有效的管理没有捷径可走。
[sound:youdao-86432cb6-393d1d89-a3e1775f-22c2fed3-4fc0a927.mp3]

translation:
n. 维持，保持; 保养，保管; 维护; 维修

分布：维护(56%)，维修(39%)，保持(3%)，抚养费(1%)，生活费用(1%)


→来自maintain的名词形式。
维护;坚持(main+len+ance,maintain的[tain,ten,tin=hold表示"拿住"]
n.维修,保养,维持,保持,生活费用After maintenance the main remains and remainders are left on the domain.维修之后,主要遗骸和剩余物留在了领地上.



noun uncountable WORK  工作   IMPROVER  ■the work needed to keep a road, building, machine, etc. in good condition 维护，保养（保持道路、建筑、机器设备等处于良好状态的工作）
•Old houses need a lot of maintenance.老房子需要大量保养。

•There are thorough maintenance checks on each plane before take-off.每架飞机起飞前都要经过彻底的维修检查。

•The magazine offers tips on cutting your house maintenance costs.这本杂志教你一些降低房屋维修花费的妙计。

['meɪn.tɪ.nənts] noun uncountable MONEY  金钱  ■money that a person must pay regularly by law in order to support their child or previous marriage partner after a divorce (= official end to a marriage) （法律规定离婚后须定期支付用以供养孩子或前配偶的）抚养费，生活费
•He refused to pay maintenance for his three children.他不肯支付三个孩子的抚养费。

['meɪn.tɪ.nənts] noun uncountable CONTINUE TO HAVE  维持  ■when something continues to exist or is not allowed to become less 维持；保持
•the maintenance of living standards生活水准的保持





life, creature, maintenance, survival, existence

life: 生命，生活
creature: 生物，动物，人
maintenance: 保持，保养，维修，一般不指人；
survival: 在困难中的生存、幸存；
existence: 艰难或无聊的生活方式


n. 维护，维修；保持； [经] 生活费用
 - conservation, keep
examples: 英 ['meɪntənəns] 美 ['meɪntənəns]
n.维修；维护；保持；生活费用；抚养费

(1) He's taking classes in car maintenance.(2) The machinery requires constant maintenance.(3) The roof of the ancient temple caved in because of bad maintenance.(4) Our policy is maintenance of friendly relations with all countries.(5) The major problem is the maintenance of the child.(6) He must pay maintenance for his three children.
(1) 他正在上汽车维修课。(2) 这些机器需要经常保养维修。(3) 那座古老的宙宇由于维护不好屋顶塌了下来。(4) 我们的政策是与所有国家保持友好关系。(5) 主要的问题是孩子的抚养费。(6) 他必须付三个孩子的抚养费。
[sound:youdao-78a1ac64-0f0bb9ff-da4aea51-4fef308f-44f2060e.mp3]

translation:
adj. 主要的; 重要的; 大调的; 主修的（课程）
n. 主修科目; 大调; 陆军少校; 成年的
vi. <美>主修，专攻; [美国英语][教育学]主修(in); 专攻

时态：majored, majoring, majors
分布：主要的(58%)，主修(26%)，较多的(4%)，陆军少校(4%)，严重的(4%)，成年人(3%)，举足轻重者(1%)


→来自拉丁语maior,来自*magjos变体，来自来自meg,伟大的，巨大的，词源同magnate,*yos,比较级后缀。引申词义主要的，主修课程等。
较大的;主要的[maj=great,表示"大,伟大"]
a.主要的n.成年人,专业学生,主修课程v.主修The minority of us are confronted with difficulty in the frontier of the major.我们少数人在该专业尖端领域面临困难.



US [-dʒɚ] adjective IMPORTANT  重要的   ESSENTIAL  [before noun] ■more important, bigger or more serious than others of the same type 较重要的；主要的；重大的
•All of her major plays have been translated into English.她的主要剧本都被译成了英文。

•Sugar is a major cause of tooth decay.糖是造成蛀牙的主要原因。

•There are two problems with this situation, one major, one minor.这个情况牵涉到两个问题，一个主要的，一个次要的。

•Citrus fruits are a major source of vitamin C.柑橘类水果是维生素C的重要来源。

•There has been a major change in attitudes recently.人们的态度近来有重大改变。

•The United States is a major influence in the United Nations.美国是联合国中具重大影响力的国家。
 Compare minor
UK ['meɪ.dʒər] US [-dʒɚ] adjective MUSIC  音乐  [after noun] specialized ■(of music) based on a scale in which there is a whole tone between the second and third notes and a half tone between the third and fourth notes 大调的，大音阶的
•the key of C majorC大调

•a concerto in A majorA 大调协奏曲
 Compare minor
UK ['meɪ.dʒər] US [-dʒɚ] noun countable OFFICER  军官  ■an officer of middle rank in the British, US and many other armed forces such as the US Air Force （英军、美军及其他军队中的）少校
•Her father was a major in the Scots Guards.她父亲是苏格兰近卫团的少校。

•I met Major Jones last year.我去年见过钟斯少校。

•[as form of address] Thank you, Major Jones.谢谢你，钟斯少校。
■the rank above captain in the armed forces 少校（军队中高于上尉的军衔）
UK ['meɪ.dʒər] US [-dʒɚ] noun countable SPECIAL SUBJECT  专门的学科  US  the most important subject that a college or university student is studying, or the student himself or herself （大学生的）专业，主修课程；（大学专业的）主修学生
•What is your major, English or French?你主修英语还是法语？

•She was a philosophy major at an Ivy League college.她曾在一所长春藤大学主修哲学

UK ['meɪ.dʒər] US [-dʒɚ] verb major in sth US ■to study something as your main subject at university 主修，以…为专业
•She majored in philosophy at Harvard.她曾在哈佛大学主修哲学。





principal, leading, primary, foremost, capital, major, chief, main

这组词都有“首要的，主要的”的意思，其区别是：
principal: 用于人时，指地位优于其他人；用于物时，指该物在大小、重要性等方面优于他物。
leading: 侧重指具有影响力或凝聚力。从而有主导和引导的作用。
primary: 通常不用于人。用于物时，指在重要性方面占第一位。
foremost: 侧重指在行进或发展过程中居首位。
capital: 着重指因重要性、意义、优越或重大而名列同类之首。
major: 指同其他人或其它物、问题等相比较，显得更加重要和突出。
chief: 拽人时，表同类中职位最高，权力最大；指物时，表同类中最重要，价值最高。
main: 通常只用于物。指在一定范围内，某物的重要性、体积或力量等超过其它物。


adj. 主要的；重要的；主修的；较多的
 - crucial, important, primary, considerable, central
n. [人类] 成年人；主修科目；陆军少校
 - adult
examples: 英 ['meɪdʒə(r)] 美 ['meɪdʒər]
adj.较多的；主要的；严重的；(音乐)大调的n.成年人；主修（科目）；陆军少校；举足轻重者v.主修

(1) The city holds the major portion of the population in the country.(2) Popular education is one of our major objectives.(3) This quartet represents a major new trend in modern music.(4) We have encountered major problems.(5) The safe disposal of nuclear waste is a major problem.(6) Majors should take more responsibilities and be more intelligent in handling personal relations.(7) Captain is an inferior rank to major.(8) An oil-producing country is considered as one of the majors.(9) She majored in maths and physics at university.
(1) 那个城市聚集了全国大部分人口。(2) 民众教育是我们的主要目标之一。(3) 这首四重奏的曲子反映了现代音乐中一种主要的新趋向。(4) 我们已遇到重大的问题。(5) 安全处置核废料是个大问题。(6) 成年人要承担更多的责任,在处理人际关系中也要变得更急灵活。(7) 上尉是低于少校的一个官阶(8) 产油国被认为是世界上的重要国家之一。(9) 她在大学期间主修数学和物理。
[sound:youdao-4093d855-9f7ed0d5-c20c5922-5a5b2727-b09f8b4b.mp3]

translation:
n. 多数; （获胜的）票数; 成年; 法定年龄

分布：多数(60%)，大多数(37%)，多数派(2%)，多数党(1%)


→来自major,主要的，-ity,名词后缀。引申词义大多数等。
大多数(major主要的+ity)[maj=great,表示"大,伟大"]
n.多数,大多数,成年,法定年龄The majority of Chinese people have bicycles.中国大多数人都有自行车.



US [-'dʒɑ:.rə.tˌi] noun NUMBER  数目   ESSENTIAL  only singular ■the larger number or part of something 大多数，大部分
•The majority of the employees have university degrees.大部分员工都有大学文凭。

•A large majority of people approve of the death sentence.大多数人赞成死刑。

•In Britain women are in the/a majority.在英国，妇女占多数。
 Compare minority countable ■in an election, the difference in the number of votes between the winning person or group and the one that comes second 多数票（选举中胜者与第二名之间的选票差额）
•The Socialists won by a narrow/large majority.社会党党员获得的票数稍微／远远超出对手，在选举中获胜。

UK [mə'dʒɒr.ə.ti] US [-'dʒɑ:.rə.tˌi] noun AGE  年龄  uncountable specialized ■the age when you legally become an adult 成年；成年的法定年龄
•the age of majority法定成年年龄

•She will inherit her father's estate when she reaches her majority.她到法定年龄时将继承父亲的遗产。





majority, most

majority: 只能修饰可数名词,  the majority of people
most: 可数不可数均可


n. 多数；成年
 - plurality, multitude
examples: 英 [mə'dʒɒrəti] 美 [mə'dʒɔːrəti]
n.大多数；多数；多数党；多数派

(1) The majority of people seem to prefer TV to radio.(2) Racism is abhorrent to the majority of people.(3) The Democrats became the majority in the election.(4) The Democrats became the majority in the election.
(1) 多数人喜欢电视胜过广播。(2) 种族主义是大多数人都憎恨的。(3) 民主党在这次选举中变成了多数党。(4) 民主党在这次选举中变成了多数党。
[sound:youdao-d9e4574a-e65d70f2-a21a5056-3b05eaef-e3cffa0b.mp3]

translation:
vt. 做，制造; 生产，制定; 使成为; 使产生
vi. 开始; 尝试; 行进; 增大
n. 制造; 生产量; 性格; 形状，样式

时态：made, making, makes
分布：做(49%)，制造(37%)，使得(5%)，成功(3%)，性格(2%)，达成(2%)，生产量(1%)，式样(1%)


→来自古英语macian,制造，形成，安排，来自mag,捏，揉，形成，词源同match,massage.最早可能是来自人类始祖捏泥土以建房，后引申多种词义。
n.(产品)来源,制法vt.制造,做成,准备They make bottles out of glass.他们用玻璃做瓶



verb (made, made)PRODUCE  生产   ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to produce something, often using a particular substance or material 做；制作；制造
•Shall I make some coffee?我煮些咖啡好吗？

•He'd made a chocolate cake.他做了一个巧克力蛋糕。

•She makes all her own clothes.她所有的衣服都是自己做的。

•[+ two objects] He made us some coffee./He made some coffee for us.他为我们煮了些咖啡。

•The pot is made to withstand high temperatures.这个罐子经特别制作，能抵抗高温。

•He works for a company that makes garden furniture.他在一家生产庭院家俱的公司工作。

•The label on the box said 'made in Taiwan'.盒子上的标签写著「台湾制造”。

•Butter is made out of/from milk.奶油由牛奶制成。

•earrings made of gold金制的耳环

•Her new trainer has promised to make an olympic athlete of her.她的新教练承诺将她训练成奥运选手。
 ESSENTIAL  transitive ■To make a film or television programme is to direct , produce it, or act in it 执导；制作；拍摄；出演
•John Huston made some great films.约翰•休斯顿执导过一些十分优秀的影片。

•The film was made by Goldcrest Productions.这部影片是由金冠制片公司制作的。

•So why didn't Garbo make any films after 1941?为甚么嘉宝1941年后就不再拍电影了？

[meɪk] verb (made, made)CAUSE  导致   ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to cause something 造成；引起；导致
•The kids made such a mess in the kitchen.孩子将厨房弄得一团糟。

•The bullet made a hole right through his chest.子弹射穿了他的胸膛。

•[+ infinitive without to] The wind is making my eyes water.风吹得我眼睛直流泪。

•What made you change your mind?甚么使你改变了想法？

•Just seeing Woody Allen's face is enough to make me laugh.只要看一眼伍迪•艾伦的脸就足以使我发笑。

•The photograph makes me look about 80!照片上的我看起来都快80岁了！

[meɪk] verb (made, made)CAUSE TO BE  使成为   ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to cause to be, to become or to appear as 使成为；使变成；使显得
•[+ noun] It's the good weather that makes Spain such a popular tourist destination.良好的气候使西班牙成为旅游胜地。

•[R + past participle] She had to shout to make herself heard above the sound of the music.她只有大声喊叫才能盖过音乐声让别人听到她的声音。

•I can make myself understood in French, but I'm not fluent.我说法语别人都明白，但说得不流利。

•They went up to the Ambassador and made themselves known (to her).他们走到大使面前，（向她）作了自我介绍。

•[+ adj] The company accounts have not yet been made public.公司账目至今尚未公开。

•The book's advertised as "navigation made easy ".这本书的广告宣传词是“航海不再难”。

•The President has made Henry Paulson his Secretary of the Treasury.总统已任命亨利‧保尔森为财政部长。

•I'll have a steak - no, make that chicken.我要一份牛排——不，改成鸡肉。
make certain/sure  ADVANCED  ■to take action so that you are certain that something happens, is true, etc 确定；确保
•I'll just make sure I've turned the oven off.我要确定一下是否关掉了烤箱。

•Make certain (that) we have enough drink for the party.我们要确保聚会上有足够的饮料。

•Make sure you're home by midnight.你务必要在午夜前回到家。

•Jones made sure of his place in the side with three fine goals.钟斯以三个漂亮的进球确保了他在队里的位置。

•I think I locked the door but I'll go back and check just to make sure.我想我把门锁上了，但还是要回去检查确认一下。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)PERFORM  执行   ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to perform an action 作出…的举动
•I must make a telephone call.我必须打个电话。

•Somebody has made a donation of £1 million to Oxfam.有人向乐施会捐赠了100万英镑。

•I need to make a trip to the shops.我要去商店买点东西。

•On foot they could only make about 20 miles a day.步行的话他们每天只能走20英里左右。

•We must make a decision by tomorrow.到明天我们就必须作出决定。

•You're not making any effort.你一点都不努力。

•Someone has made a mistake/an error.有人犯了错误／出了差错。

•We're making good progress.我们进展顺利。

•She has made a request for a new car.她申请要一辆新汽车。

•We made an offer of £150 000 for the house.我们出价15万英镑买这座房子。

•She made a short speech.她作了简短的发言。

•Shall we make a start on the work?我们现在开始工作好吗？

•Can I make a suggestion ?我能否提个建议？

•We made good time getting across town.我们快速穿过了小镇。

•There's a drunk at the door making trouble.有个醉汉在门口闹事。
make room/space/way ■If you make room/space/way for something or someone, you move or move other things, so that there is space for them. 腾出地方／让路
[meɪk] verb (made, made)FORCE  强迫  make sb do sth  ESSENTIAL  ■to force someone or something to do something 强迫…做
•You can't make him go if he doesn't want to.如果他不想去，你不能强迫他去。

•The vet put something down the dog's throat to make it vomit.兽医为狗灌了些东西，迫使它呕吐。
be made to do sth  ESSENTIAL  ■to be forced to do something 被迫做
•The prisoners are made to dig holes and fill them in again.那些囚犯被强迫挖洞，然后再将之填平。
  Common Learner Errors   make sb do sthWhen make  has the meaning 'to force', it is followed by a verb in the infinitive without 'to'.Do not say 'make someone to do something', say make someone do something.✗ They made us to pay extra for the drinks.They made us pay extra for the drinks.Warning:  in passive sentences, use the infinitive with 'to'.Don't say 'be made do something', say be made to do something.
[meɪk] verb (made, made)BE OR BECOME  是／成为   IMPROVER  [L only + noun] ■to be or become something, usually by having the necessary characteristics （通常因有必需的特点而）成为，变为
•I don't think he will ever make a (good) lawyer.我认为他不能够当（好）律师。

•He's a competent enough officer, but I doubt he'll ever make general.他是个很能干的军官，但我怀疑他能否成为将军。

•It's a story that would make a great film.这是个能用来拍好电影的故事。

•She decided the back room would make a good study.她认为后面的房间很适合用作书房。

•Champagne and caviar make a wonderful combination.香槟和鱼子酱搭配起来棒极了。

•The story makes fascinating reading.这个故事读起来很精彩。
 IMPROVER  [L only + noun] ■If people or things make a particular pattern, they are arranged in that way 形成；组成
•Let's make a circle.我们来围成一个圈。

•Those seven bright stars make the shape of a saucepan.那七颗明亮的星星构成一个长柄锅的形状。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)TOTAL  总数   IMPROVER  [L only + noun] transitive ■to produce a total when added together 等于；合计为
•12 and 12 make 24.12加12等于24。

•Today's earthquake makes five since the beginning of the year.今天的地震是今年以来的第五次。

•[+ obj + noun] I've got 29 different teapots in my collection - if I buy this one that'll make it 30.我已经收集了29个各式各样的茶壶——如果买下这个，就有30个了。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)CALCULATE  计算   ADVANCED  transitive + object + noun ■to calculate as 计算；估计
•How much do you make the total?你算出的总数是多少？

•I make the answer (to be) 105.6.我算出的答案是105.6。

•What do you make the time?/What time do you make it?你估计现在几点了？

[meɪk] verb (made, made)EARN/GET  赚得／获得   ADVANCED  transitive ■to earn or get 赚得；获得
•She makes $100 000 a year as a doctor.她行医每年收入十万美元。

•How do you make a living as a painter?你当画家如何谋生？

•The company has made huge profits/losses.公司盈利丰厚／亏损严重。

•He's very good at making new friends.他善于结交新朋友。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)ARRIVE  到达   ADVANCED  transitive informal ■to arrive at or reach, especially successfully （尤指成功地）赶到，到达
•She made it to the airport just in time to catch her plane.她及时赶到机场，搭上了班机。

•He made it to the bed and then collapsed.他走到床边就倒下了。

•Could you make a meeting at 8 am?/Could you make 8 am for the meeting?能在早上八点见面吗？

[meɪk] verb (made, made)PERFECT  完美  transitive informal ■to cause to be perfect 使完美；完善
•Those little bows round the neck really make the dress!领口的小蝴蝶结确实为这条连身裙锦上添花！

[meɪk] verb (made, made)be made for sb/sth ■to be exactly suitable for someone or something 和…是绝配
•Paul and Ann were made for each other.保罗和安是天造地设的一对。

•This wallpaper's just made for my bedroom.这种墙纸和我的卧室简直是绝配。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)be made of money ■to be rich 富有
•No you can't have another bike - I'm not made of money!不行，你不能再买脚踏车了——我又不是富翁！

[meɪk] verb (made, made)Do you want to make something/anything of it? informal ■something that you say to someone as a way of threatening or offering to fight them when they disagree with you 你想来真的吗？
[meɪk] verb (made, made)
make 1	make sth up as you go along * to invent a story or a tune without having thought before about how it will end 随口编造
[meɪk] verb (made, made)make a day/night/evening/weekend of it ■to make an activity longer or combine a series of activities so that they last for the whole of that particular period of time 花一天／夜／晚／个周末的时间做…
•Let's make an evening of it and catch the last train home.我们玩一个晚上，然后赶最后一班火车回家。

•We don't get out often so we thought we'd make a day of it.我们不常出来，所以决定要出来就呆上一整天。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)make as if to do sth ■If you make as if to do something, you seem as if that is what you are going to do 好像要做；假装要做
•He made as if to speak.他似乎有话要说。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)make do ■to manage to live without things that you would like to have or with things of a worse quality than you would like 凑合；将就
•We didn't have cupboards so we made do with boxes.我们没有橱柜，只好将就用箱子了。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)make it (to the top) ■to be very successful 非常成功
•She's very ambitious but I doubt she'll ever make it to the top.她很有抱负，但我怀疑她究竟能否成功。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)make it up to sb ■to do something good for someone you have upset, in order to become friends with them again 补偿（自己伤害了的人）
•I'm sorry we can't take you with us, but I promise I'll make it up to you somehow.很抱歉我们不能带你去，但我保证以后设法补偿你。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)make it with sb US informal ■to have sex with someone 与（某人）性交
[meɪk] verb (made, made)make like US ■to pretend 假装，装作
•She made like she was about to leave, but then stayed for hours.她装出要走的样子，可一呆又是几个小时。

•Stop making like you know everything, OK?别装作无所不知，好吗？

[meɪk] verb (made, made)make much/a lot of sb informal ■to treat someone very well 对（某人）很好
•His mother used to make much of him when he went home for holidays.过去他放假回家时，母亲总是为他忙前忙后。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)make or break sth ■to make something a success or a failure 成就或毁掉
•Recognition by this organization can make or break a career.获这个组织承认可能会成就事业，也可能会毁了事业。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)be make or break for sb/sth ■to make someone or something a success or a failure 是…的成败关键
•The Milan show will be make or break for his new designs.米兰时装展将会决定他的新设计的成败。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)make time ■to make certain you have some time when you are not busy in order to do something you think you should do 腾出时间
•It's important to make time to read to your children.腾出一点时间念书给你的孩子听很重要。

•In a relationship you have to make time for each other.恋爱中的男女必须为彼此挤出点时间。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)make to do sth formal ■If you make to do something, you are just going to do it when something interrupts you 正想做（而被打断）
•I made to leave but she called me back.我正要离开，她把我叫了回去。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)what sb is (really) made of ■how strong, clever or brave someone is （某人）的真本事
•The 1500 metres race next week will be a chance for her to show what she's made of.下周的1500米赛跑是她大显身手的机会。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make for somewhere/sth ■to go in the direction of a place or thing 走向；向…前进
•They made for the centre of town.他们向城镇中心进发。
⇒ See also make towards
[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make for sth ■to result in or make possible 导致；使成为可能
•Having faster computers would make for a more efficient system.配备速度更快的电脑可以提高系统的工作效率。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make sth into sth  IMPROVER  ■to change something into something else 把…变成
•They've made the spare room into an office.他们已把空置的房间改成办公室。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make of sth/sb ■If you ask someone what they make of someone or something, you want to know their opinion about that person or thing, often because there is something strange about them 看待；理解
•Can you make anything of this information?你怎么看这个消息？

•What do you make of the new boss?你认为新老板如何？

•I don't know what to make of it.我不知道如何理解它才对。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make sth of sth make enough/much/more, etc. of sth ■to give a particular level of value or importance to something 给予…足够／很多／更多等的重视
•You should make more of your IT skills on the application form.你填申请表时应该更加突出你的 IT 技能。

•I think we make too much of the benefits of Western society.我认为我们过分强调了西方社会的好处。
 Compare make light of at light
[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make off informal ■to leave quickly, usually in order to escape 匆忙离开；（通常指）逃走
•The burglars made off before the police arrived.窃贼在警方赶到前逃走了。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make off with sth informal ■to steal something 偷走
•Somebody broke into the shop and made off with several TVs and videos.有人闯入商店，偷走了几台电视机和录影机。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] make sth/sb out ■to see, hear or understand something or someone with difficulty （费力）看出，听清，辨认出，弄懂
•The numbers are too small - I can't make them out at all.数字太小了——我根本看不清。

•I can't make out your writing.我看不懂你写了甚么。

•She's a strange person - I can't make her out at all.她是个怪人——我完全搞不懂她。

•[+ question word] Nobody can make out why you should have been attacked.没有人明白你为甚么遇击。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] make sth out ■to write all the necessary information on an official document 开出；填写
•I made a cheque out for £20 to 'Henry's Supermarket'.我开了一张20英镑的支票，抬头是“亨利超市”。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make out sth informal ■to state, usually falsely, that something is true 声称；（通常指）谎称
•[R + to infinitive] He made himself out to be a millionaire.他谎称自己是百万富翁。

•[+ to be] The British weather is not always as bad as it is made out to be.英国的天气并非总是像人们所说的那样糟糕。

•[+ (that)] He made out (that) he had been living in Paris all year.他声称自己当年整年都住在巴黎。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make out US informal SUCCEED  ■to deal with a situation, usually in a successful way （通常指成功地）处理，应付
•How is Frances making out in her new job?弗朗西丝的新工作做得怎么样？

•The business made out better than expected in 1992 and profits were slightly up.1992年企业经营状况比预期理想，利润略微上升。
HAVE SEX  ■to kiss and touch in a sexual way, or to succeed in having sex with someone 亲吻爱抚；性交
•Boys at that age are only interested in making out with girls.那个年纪的男孩只对和女孩亲热感兴趣。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] make sth over to sb ■to give something, such as money or land, to someone so that they legally own it 将…移交给（某人）；（以法律形式）把…转让给（某人）
•Just before her death, she had made over $100 000 to her new husband.就在临死之前，她将10万美元转给了新任丈夫。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make towards sth/sb mainly UK ■to go in the direction of something or someone 向…走去，走向
make 2	1. He made towards the door, but stopped and turned to face me. 他向门口走去，但又停了下来，转身看着我。⇒ See also make for
[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] make sth up INVENT   IMPROVER  ■to invent something, such as an excuse or a story, often in order to deceive （常为骗人而）编造（借口、故事等）
•I made up an excuse about having to look after the kids.我编了个借口，说必须照顾小孩。

•My dad was always really good at making up stories.我爸爸总是很善于编故事。
PREPARE  ■to prepare or arrange something by putting different things together 准备；安排；整理
•Could you make up a list of all the things that need to be done?你能否将要做的所有事情列张清单？

•He asked the man behind the counter to make up a box with a mixed selection of chocolates.他请售货员把多种巧克力拼凑起来，放好在盒子里。

•The maid will make up your room later.服务员稍后将打扫您的房间。
■specialized ■to produce or prepare something from cloth （用布）缝制，制作
•We could use the rest of the material to make up some curtains.我们可以用剩下的布料做些窗帘。
■specialized ■If you make up a page, book or newspaper, you arrange the text and pictures in the form in which they will be printed. 为（页面、书或报纸）排版■If you make up a bed for someone, you put sheets and covers on a bed so that they have a place to sleep in your home. 铺床■UK ■If you make up a fire, you prepare it or put more wood or coal on it when it is burning. 生（火）；给（火）添柴（或煤）COMPLETE  ■to make an amount of something complete or correct 补充，补足
•I have £20 000 and I need £25 000 but my parents have promised to make up the difference.我有两万英镑，但我却需要两万五千，幸好父母答应帮我凑齐。

•UK I suspect we were only invited to make up numbers (= to provide enough people).我怀疑我们只是被邀请来充数的。
REPLACE  ■to reduce or replace something, usually an amount of time or work, that has been lost 补上；补偿；弥补；替代
•We're hoping to make up time on the return journey by not stopping at night.我们希望在回程时通宵赶路，以弥补失去了的时间。

•You'll have to make up the work you've missed while you were away.你必须补做缺勤期间本应完成的工作。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] make (sb/sth) up ■to put make-up on your face, or on another person's face, to improve or change its appearance （为…）化妆；（给…）化装
•She takes ages to make up in the mornings.她每天早上花很长时间化妆。

•For the film, they made him up as an Indian.在这部电影中，他需要化装成印第安人。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make up sth ■to form a particular thing, amount or number as a whole 组成，构成
•Road accident victims make up almost a quarter of the hospital's patients.车祸伤者几乎占了医院病人的四分之一。

•The book is made up of a number of different articles.这本书汇集了多篇文章。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make up (also make it up) ■to forgive someone and be friendly with them again after an argument or disagreement 和解，言归于好
•They kissed and made up, as usual.像往常一样，他们亲个吻和好了。

•We often quarrel but we always make it up soon after.我们常常吵架，但总是很快就和好。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make up for sth  ADVANCED  ■to take the place of something lost or damaged or to compensate for something bad with something good 补偿，弥补
•No amount of money can make up for the death of a child.无论多少钱都无法补偿孩子的死。

•This year's good harvest will make up for last year's bad one.今年的丰收将弥补去年的歉收。

•[+ -ing verb] He bought me dinner to make up for being so late the day before.他请我吃晚餐，作为对前一天迟到的补偿。
make up for lost time ■to enjoy an experience as much as possible because you did not have the opportunity to do it earlier in life 弥补失去的时光，尽情享受
•I didn't travel much in my twenties but I'm certainly making up for lost time now.我二十多岁时很少去旅行，现在一定要弥补失去的时光。

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make up to sb UK disapproving ■to be too friendly to someone or to praise them in order to get advantages 讨好，奉承，巴结（某人）
•Have you seen the disgusting way she makes up to the boss?你见过她巴结老板的丑态吗？

[meɪk] verb (made, made)  Phrasal Verbs   make with sth US old-fashioned slang ■to give, bring or do something 给；带着；做
•He pointed a gun and said "Make with the money bags, baby!"他用枪指着对方说：“把钱袋给我，小子！”

[meɪk] noun countable ■a type of product or the name of the company which made it （产品的）型号；品牌，牌子
•What make is your stereo?你的音响是甚么品牌的？

[meɪk] noun countable be on the make disapproving ■to be trying very hard to get more money and power 拚命追逐名利




invent, compose, make, create, design, produce

这组词都有“创造”的意思，其区别是：
invent: 主要用于科技领域，指通过思考、研究或实验制造出新的前所未有、极为有用的东西。
compose: 多指音乐或诗歌、画的创作。
make: 最普通用词，指任何东西的创作或制造。
create: 侧重创造出来的东西以前并不存在，或者指独具特色的创作。
design: 主要指在艺术或技术领域的创作设计，强调构思多于实际制造。
produce: 指产品的生产，或作品创作的完成。



manufacture, fabricate, make, produce

这组词都有“做，制造”的意思，其区别是：
manufacture: 正式用词，一般指用机器大规模地批量生产各种生活或生产用品。
fabricate: 特指按照标准样式制作或把材料或部件组合成一个整体。
make: 普通用词，很常用，含义广，既可指制造具体的东西，也可指完成一种行为。
produce: 普通用词，侧重大量地生产出各种生产用品和生活用品。强调结果。也用于引申。



cause, get, have, make, render

这组词都有“使，使得”的意思，其区别是：
cause: 正式用词，侧重指使某事发生的原因。
get: 侧重指劝某人做某事，或指使某事物处于某种状态或产生某种结果。
have: 普通用词，指让某人做某事。
make: 普通用词，指强迫或劝诱他人做某事。
render: 书面用词，多指因外界因素而使某人或某物处于某种状态。


vt. 使得；进行；布置，准备，整理；制造；认为；获得；形成；安排；引起；构成
 - earn, acquire, prepare, provide, expect
vi. 开始；前进；增大；被制造
 - proceed, progress, increase
n. 制造；构造； [心理] 性情
 - formation, manufacture, constitution, fabric, machining
examples: 英 [meɪk] 美 [meɪk]
v.做；制造；使得；赚（钱）；成功；达成n.性格；式样；制造；生产量

(1) If I had the time, I 'd make something better.(2) Her jokes made us all laugh.(3) If you take my advice, you will make a lot of money.(4) He's got a strong will and he'll make it.(5) She would have made an excellent teacher.(6) Finally,I've got to find out what make of man he was.(7) I don't like the make of her coat.(8) She bought a dinner set of Chinese make.(9) The annual make of the automobile factory is 200 thousand.
(1) 如果有时间的话,我会做些更好吃的东西。(2) 她说的笑话把我们都逗乐了。(3) 如果你采纳我的建议,你将赚很多钱。(4) 他意志很坚强,他会成功的。(5) 她本可以成为杰出的教师。(6) 最后,我终于知道了他是怎么样的一个人。(7) 我不喜欢她衣服的样式。(8) 他买了一套中国牌子的西装。(9) 那个汽车厂的年产量为20万辆。
[sound:youdao-bdbb5e43-1c9d9201-0c6a4e06-7b8bf5e3-4c6fa782.mp3]

translation:
n. 男人; 人类; 男子汉; 雇工
vt. 使振作; 操纵; 给…配置人员; 在…就位
int. （表示惊讶、气愤等）嘿，天哪

时态：manned, manning, mans
分布：人(87%)，男人(11%)，男子汉(1%)，情人(1%)


→来自古英语man,人类，男人，女人，来自Proto-Germanic*manwaz,来自man,人，进一步来自men,思考，词源同mind,mania.后不再用于女人义。
n.(pl.men)人;人类(单数,不加冠词);男人He has grown up to be a man.他已长大成人.



noun (plural men)MALE  男子   ESSENTIAL  countable ■an adult male human being 成年男子，男人
•a young/tall man年轻／高个子的男子

•men and women男人和女人

•the man in the green jacket穿绿夹克的男子

•the men's 400 metres champion男子400米赛跑冠军

•Steve can solve anything - the man's a genius.史蒂夫甚么疑难都解决得到——此人是个天才。
 ESSENTIAL  countable ■a male employee, without particular rank or title （没有明确职位或头衔的）男性员工
•The gas company said they would send some men to fix the heating system.煤气公司说会派人来修暖气。

•The man from the BBC wrote some positive things about the film.英国广播公司的人对影片作了正面的评价。

•The military expedition was made up of 100 officers and men.军事探险队由100名军官和士兵组成。

•Our man in Washington sent us the news by fax yesterday.我们驻华盛顿的同事昨天把这个消息传真过来。

•old use My man (= male servant) will show you to the door.我的男仆会送您到门口。
a marketing/advertising, etc. man ■a man typical of or involved in marketing/advertising, etc. 市场行销／广告等人员countable informal ■a woman's husband or male partner 丈夫；情夫；男朋友
•I hear she's got a new man.我听说她找了个新男朋友。

•Is there a man in her life?她有男人吗？
■mainly US informal ■used when talking to someone, especially a man （用于称呼，尤指对男子）老兄，老弟，小伙子，朋友
•Hey, man, how are you doing?嘿，老兄，你好吗？
man and wife old-fashioned ■If a man and a woman are man and wife, they are married to each other. 夫妻，夫妇the man only singular US slang ■the police 员警
[mæn] noun (plural men)PEOPLE  人  uncountable ■the human race 人类，人
•Man is still far more intelligent than the cleverest robot.人类仍远比最有智慧的机器人聪明。

•Man is rapidly destroying the Earth.人类正迅速毁灭地球。

•This is one of the most dangerous substances known to man.这是人类已知的最危险的物质之一。

•Try to imagine what life must have been like for Neolithic man 10 000 years ago.想像一下一万年前新石器时代的人的生活是甚么样子。
countable literary or old-fashioned ■a person of either sex （不论性别的）人
•All men are equal in the sight of the law.法律面前人人平等。

[mæn] noun (plural men)OBJECT  物体  countable ■any of the objects that are moved or played with in games such as chess （国际象棋等游戏中的）棋子
[mæn] noun (plural men)as one man formal ■If a group of people do something as one man they do it together at exactly the same time （全体）一致地
•As one man, the delegates made for the exit.全体代表一起走向出口。

[mæn] noun (plural men)It's every man for himself. ■something that you say which means that everyone in a particular situation is trying to do what is best for themselves and no one is trying to help anyone else 人不为己，天诛地灭（指在某种特定场合，每个人都会尽力维护自己的利益，而不会帮助他人）
•It might be a civilized place to shop at other times but come the January sales, it's every man for himself.人们在购物时通常都能保持风度，但一月大减价则除外，这个时候，人不为己，天诛地灭。

[mæn] noun (plural men)make a man (out) of sb ■to cause a young man or boy to act like an adult and take responsibility 使（年轻人或男孩）具有男子气概；使长大成人
•A couple of years in the army should make a man of him.几年的军中生活会将他磨炼成男子汉。

[mæn] noun (plural men)man and boy UK old-fashioned ■all a man's life 从童年到成年；一辈子
•From 1910 to 1970 he worked in that factory, man and boy.从1910年到1970年，他一生都在那家工厂工作。

[mæn] noun (plural men)be man enough to do sth ■to be brave enough to do something 敢于
•He was man enough to admit he had made a mistake.他敢于承认自己所犯的错误。

[mæn] noun (plural men)the man in the moon ■(in children's stories) the human face that you can imagine you see when you look at the moon 月中人，月宫人（在儿童故事中，指看着月亮幻想所看到的人）
[mæn] noun (plural men)(as) man to man ■If two men talk (as) man to man, they talk seriously and honestly together as equals. （谈话）开诚布公地，平等而坦率地
[mæn] noun (plural men)man's best friend ■a dog 狗
[mæn] noun (plural men)man's inhumanity to man ■the cruelty  which people show to each other 人与人之间的冷酷
•Man's inhumanity to man never fails to shock me.人与人之间的残酷无情每每使我不寒而栗。

[mæn] noun (plural men)a man's man ■a man who enjoys men's activities and being with other men 男人中的男人（喜爱男性活动、喜欢和男性呆在一起的男子）
•Terry's what you'd call a man's man - I don't expect you'd find him at the ballet too many nights a week.特里是人们所说的男人中的男人——我想你不可能看见他一周好几个晚上都在看芭蕾舞。

[mæn] noun (plural men)to a man ■every person in a group 每人，全体无例外地
•There were 400 people at the meeting and they all, to a man, voted in favour.400人参加了会议，他们全都投了赞成票。

[mæn] noun (plural men)You the man! US not standard ■used to praise a man who has done something well （用于称赞）做得不错，老兄！真有你的！
[mæn] verb transitive (-nn-)■To man something such as a machine or vehicle is to be present in order to operate it 为…配备人手
•The phones are manned 24 hours a day.电话每天24小时都有人值班。

•Barricades were erected against the advancing government troops and they were manned throughout the night.设置了路障以阻挡政府军的前进，并且整夜有人看守。

•Man the pumps!派人看着抽水机！
⇒ See also overmanned;undermanned;unmanned
[mæn] exclamation informal ■used as an exclamation, especially when you are expressing a strong emotion （用作感叹词，尤用于表示强烈的感情）啊，呀，哈，嘿
•Man, we had a good time - we drank all through the night!嘿，我们昨晚真是尽兴，喝了一夜的酒！





humanity, mankind, man

这组词都有“人类”的意思，其区别是：
humanity: 书面用词，集合名词，多用于文学作品中，作人类解时，侧重有同情心、理解力和崇高品质。
mankind: 集体名词，语体庄重，泛指过去、现在和未来的人类。
man: 指各时代的全体人类。



a man, man

a man: 一个男人 
man: 人类, Man will conquer nature.


n. 人； [人类] 男人；人类；丈夫；雇工
 - person, mankind, boy, humanity, guy
vt. 操纵；给…配置人员；使增强勇气；在…就位
 - guide, manipulate
examples: 英 [mæn] 美 [mæn]
n.男人；人；男子汉；情人；强者；下属v.使...振奋；为...配备人手

(1) She married a man who put her on a pedestal.(2) All men are born equal.(3) He played the man in the time of great trouble.(4) Have you met Jessica's new man?(5) A strong man will struggle with the storms of fate.(6) The manager gave the men their instructions.(7) The soldier manned himself for the battle ahead.(8) They decided to man the lifeboat.
(1) 她嫁给了一个对她十分崇拜的男人。(2) 人生而平等。(3) 他在极为困难的时候显示出男子汉的气概。(4) 你见过杰西卡的新男朋友吗？(5) 强者能同命运的风暴抗争。(6) 经理给雇员下达了指示。(7) 那个士兵使自己振作起来以应付眼前的战斗。(8) 他们决定给救生船配备船员。

translation:
vt. 使用; 完成（困难的事）; 经营; 明智地使用（金钱、时间、信息等）
vt. & vi. 办理，设法对付
vi. 能解决（问题）; 应付（困难局面等）; 凑合着活下去; 支撑

时态：managed, managing, manages
分布：管理(88%)，经营(7%)，提供(3%)，设法对付(1%)，做成(1%)


→来自拉丁语manus,手，词源同manual.引申词义用手操作，控制，管理，应付等。
办理;管理(man+age→用手做→引申为管理)[man,maun=hand,表示"手"]
v.经营,管理,处理;设法,对付;操纵,运用The manly Roman woman manager by the banner had man's manner.军旗旁那位有男子气概的古罗马女经理具有男子风度.



verb SUCCEED  成功   ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to succeed in doing something, especially something difficult 成功做到，顺利完成（尤指困难之事）
•[+ to infinitive] Did you manage to get any bread?你弄到面包了吗？

•I only just managed to finish on time.我勉强准时完成。

•A small dog had somehow managed to survive the fire.一只小狗在火灾中侥幸逃生。

•I can't manage all this work on my own.我自己无法独自完成全部工作。

•Don't worry about us - we'll manage!别担心我们——我们应付得了的！

•Can you manage dinner on Saturday (= Will you be able to come to dinner) ?你星期六能来吃晚餐吗？

•mainly UK I'm afraid I can't manage the time (= I'm too busy) to see you at the moment.恐怕我现在抽不出时间去见你。
intransitive ■to succeed in living on a small amount of money 勉强生活下去，勉强度日
•After she lost her job, they had to manage on his salary.她失业后，他们不得不靠他的薪水勉强过活。

['mæn.ɪdʒ] verb CONTROL  控制   ESSENTIAL  transitive ■to be responsible for controlling or organizing someone or something especially a business 管理，掌管；经营（尤指企业）
•Has she had any experience of managing large projects?她有负责大型专案计划的经验吗？

•He's not very good at managing people.他不是很善于管理别人。

•His job involved managing large investment funds.他的工作涉及管理巨额投资基金。

•When you have a job as well as children to look after, you have to learn how to manage your time.如果你既要工作又要照顾孩子，就必须学会如何分配时间。
⇒ See also mismanage




manage, try

manage: to do设法做成了某事,
try: to do尽力去做某事但不一定成功 He tried to pass the exam, but he failed.



direct, control, supervise, govern, administer, rule, manage

这组词都有“管理、支配”的意思，其区别是：
direct: 侧重行使领导或指导权。
control: 含义广泛的常用词，指对人或物施以约束或控制的力量。
supervise: 侧重指运用本身的或被授予的权力来管理、检查工作，含监督意味。
govern: 侧重指运用任何控制的权力来统治或管理一个国家、一个社会或一个部门，暗含能力和知识的运用。
administer: 指官方的或正式的对事务的管理。
rule: 强调用绝对或独裁的权力来管理或统治。
manage: 强调对具体事务机构进行管理，有时含受权管理或处理之意。



deal with, cope with, dispose of, manage, handle

这些动词或短语动词都含有“处理”，“对付”之意。
deal with: 既可指处理具体事情，也可指处理或解决具有抽象意义的问题。
cope with: 指成功地处理或对付更为重大，更为严重的问题或事物。
dispose of: 与deal with同义，普通用法。
manage: 指处理日常事务与工作，也可指经营管理。
handle: 从原义“手柄”，转引申为作“处理”解时，其内涵是管理和操纵。


vt. 管理；经营；控制；设法
 - possess, run, regulate, conduct, direct
vi. 处理；应付过去
 - cope with, handle with
examples: 英 ['mænɪdʒ] 美 ['mænɪdʒ]
v.管理；经营；做成；设法对付；提供；有空

(1) He managed the company when his father was away.(2) The success of the restaurant lies in that it is well managed.(3) His wife knows how to manage him when he is angry.(4) We can only manage $100 a week for rent.(5) Can you manage 5 o'clock next Monday?
(1) 他父亲离开的时候,由他管理公司。(2) 这个餐厅的成功在于它的完善经营。(3) 他的妻子知道在他生气时怎么对付他。(4) 我们一个星期只能提供100美元的租金。(5) 你下个星期一五点钟有时间吗？

translation:
n. 管理; 管理人员; 管理技巧，处事的能力

分布：管理(94%)，管理部门(5%)，手腕(1%)


→来自manage,管理。
管理(manage管理)[-ment 1.表名词"行为或结果"2.表示具体物]
n.经营,管理;处理,操纵;管理部门They negotiated with the management for an improvement in working conditions.他们与资方交涉,以便改善工作条件.



noun  ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■the control and organization of something 管理；经营
•The company has suffered from several years of bad management.公司数年来一直经营不善。

•There is a need for stricter financial management.有必要加强财务管理。

•a management training scheme管理培训计划
countable [+ sing/pl verb] ■the group of people responsible for controlling and organizing a company 管理层，资方
•Management has/have offered staff a 3% pay increase.资方提出为职工加薪3%。




n. [管理] 管理；管理人员；管理部门；操纵；经营手段
 - governance, supervision, regulation, control, conservancy
examples: 英 ['mænɪdʒmənt] 美 ['mænɪdʒmənt]
n.管理；管理部门；手腕

(1) The farm prospered through good management.(2) The failure of the scheme was due to bad management.(3) The management took all reasonable safety precautions.(4) She gets them to accept these changes by tactful management.
(1) 由于管理有方，农场兴旺发达。(2) 计划的失败是由于管理不善。(3) 管理部门采取了一切合理的安全措施。(4) 她用机智的手段使他们接受了这些改变。
[sound:youdao-224f07f2-d2d04e34-f69ae19f-8f25421a-c9f99d8b.mp3]

translation:
n. 处理者，经理，管理人; 干事，理事; 〈美〉（政党等的）领袖; 策士，干才，干练的人

分布：经理(95%)，管理者(4%)，管家(1%)


→来自manage,管理。
n.经理,管理人The manly Roman woman manager by the banner had man's manner.军旗旁那位有男子气概的古罗马女经理具有男子风度.



US [-dʒɚ] noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■the person who is responsible for managing an organization 经理；主管
•a bank manager银行经理

•a station manager车站主管

•the production manager生产部经理

•I wish to speak to the manager.我想找经理谈谈。
■the person whose job is to organize and sometimes train a sports team （运动队的）经理，主教练
•a football manager足球队经理
■The manager of a singer, actor or other performer is a person whose job is to arrange the business part of their work. （歌手、演员或其他表演者的）经纪人



n. 经理；管理人员
 - executive, gerente
examples: 英 ['mænɪdʒə(r)] 美 ['mænɪdʒər]
n.经理；管理者；管家
(1) The manager let us cut the cackle.(2) I want to speak to the sales manager.(3) He is the manager of the warehouse.(4) You could talk with the related manager of the school about the issue.
(1) 经理让我们不要闲谈。(2) 我想找营业部经理。(3) 他是这个仓库的管理者。(4) 你可以和学校相关管理人员说说这事。
[sound:youdao-bf6e6316-e1ea8bde-a1a1a051-cb3c0f70-86056e74.mp3]

translation:
n. 人类; 男性，男子

分布：人类(99%)，男人(1%)


→man,人，kind,种类。
n.人类It will bring peace to all mankind.它会给全人类带来和平.



noun uncountable (also humankind) ■the whole of the human race, including both men and women 人类
•Mankind has always been obsessed by power.人类总是迷恋权力。
 Compare womankind




humanity, mankind, man

这组词都有“人类”的意思，其区别是：
humanity: 书面用词，集合名词，多用于文学作品中，作人类解时，侧重有同情心、理解力和崇高品质。
mankind: 集体名词，语体庄重，泛指过去、现在和未来的人类。
man: 指各时代的全体人类。


n. 人类；男性
 - humanity, people
examples: 英 [mæn'kaɪnd] 美 [mæn'kaɪnd]
n.人类；男人

(1) Mankind learns its first language in early childhood.(2) Christ's atonement is for the sins of mankind.(3) Sympathy is the feeling characteristic of mankind.(4) Genetic engineering will have revolutionary consequences for mankind.(5) Mankind and womankind both like praise.
(1) 人类是在幼年开始学习第一种语言的。(2) 耶稣的赎罪是为了人类的罪恶。(3) 同情心是人类特有的感情。(4) 遗传工程将对人类产生深远的影响。(5) 男人与女人都喜欢被赞美。
[sound:youdao-37613231-47ad35db-27fa58bf-d789c5fc-9daf5cde.mp3]

translation:
adj. 有男子气概的; 适合男子的; 强壮的
adv. 以男人的方式

级别：manlier, manliest
分布：适于男人的(35%)，强壮的(33%)，像男人的(16%)，男子般地(16%)


→来自man,男人。即像人男人的。
有男子气的(man男人)[-ly 1.表形容词,通常加在名词后2.表副词,通常放在形容词后]



adjective approving ■having the qualities which people think a man should have 具有男子气概的
•He has such a manly voice.他的嗓音很有男子气。

•My mother used to tell me it wasn't manly for little boys to cry.我母亲过去常说哭哭啼啼的小男孩不是男子汉。





masculine, male, manly

这组词都有“男人的，男性的”的意思，其区别是：
masculine: 指有男子特征的，阳刚的。用于形容女性时，含轻蔑意味。
male: 单纯指男性或雄性。
manly: 指适合男子的、有男子汉气慨的。


adj. 男子气概的；强壮的；适于男人的
 - strong, tough
examples: 英 ['mænli] 美 ['mænli]
adj.像男人的；强壮的；适于男人的adv.男子般地
(1) A man lacking courage and other qualities deemed manly.(2) Football is a manly sport.(3) He looks very manly in his uniform.
(1) 软弱的男子，懦夫缺乏勇气和其它所谓男人品质的男人(2) 足球是一项激烈的体育运动。(3) 他穿着制服十分精神。
[sound:youdao-d0a4e9e9-80ca1cc4-9acbf0b4-63e2fad2-481e1d2e.mp3]

translation:
n. 方式，方法，做法; 态度，样子，举止; 礼貌，规矩; 风俗，习惯，惯例，生活方式

分布：方式(62%)，举止(27%)，礼貌(10%)，习俗(1%)


→来自拉丁语manus,手，词源同manual.引申词义手的姿势，举手投足，举止，礼仪等。
n.方式;举止;(pl.)风度,礼貌;规矩;风俗The manly Roman woman manager by the banner had man's manner.军旗旁那位有男子气概的古罗马女经理具有男子风度.



US [-ɚ] noun WAY  方式   IMPROVER  only singular ■the way in which something is done 方式，方法
•She stared at me in an accusing manner.她以责备的目光注视着我。

•He was elected in the normal manner.他依正常程式当选。

•It was the manner of her death that stuck in the public's mind.她的死亡方式使公众很受触动。
in the manner of sth ■in the style of something 以…的风格
•Her latest film is a suspense thriller very much in the manner of Hitchcock.她的最新影片是部悬疑惊险片，与希区考克的风格很相似。

UK ['mæn.ər] US [-ɚ] noun BEHAVIOUR  行为   IMPROVER  only singular ■the usual way in which you behave towards other people, or the way you behave on a particular occasion 态度；举止
•She has a rather cold, unfriendly manner.她的态度相当冷淡、不友善。

•As soon as he realized that we weren't going to buy anything, his whole manner changed.他一发觉到我们不会买任何东西，态度就彻底改变了。

UK ['mæn.ər] US [-ɚ] noun POLITE BEHAVIOUR  有礼的行为  manners  ADVANCED  [plural] ■polite ways of treating other people and behaving in public 风度；礼貌；礼仪
•He needs to be taught some manners.他需要学些礼仪。

•It's bad manners to eat with your mouth open.张着嘴吃东西是不文雅的。

•It's considered good manners in some societies to leave a little food on your plate.在某些社会中，人们认为在碟中剩下少许食物是礼貌的表现。

UK ['mæn.ər] US [-ɚ] noun TYPE  种类  uncountable formal ■a type 种类，类型
•Very little is known about the new candidate - what manner of man is he?人们对新候选人所知甚少——他是哪一种人？

UK ['mæn.ər] US [-ɚ] noun all manner of sth ■a lot of different types 各种各样的
•There are all manner of architectural styles in the capital.首都汇集了各种建筑风格。

UK ['mæn.ər] US [-ɚ] noun as (if) to the manner born formal ■If you do something as (if) to the manner born, you do it very well and very naturally as if it is usual and easy for you. 似乎天生就适合
UK ['mæn.ər] US [-ɚ] noun in a manner of speaking formal ■used for saying that something is partly true 不妨说，可以说；在某种意义上
•She's his partner, in a manner of speaking.在某种意义上，她是他的伙伴。

UK ['mæn.ər] US [-ɚ] noun not by any manner of means UK old-fashioned ■not in any way 决不，无论如何也不
•I'm not satisfied with his excuse - not by any manner of means.我不满意他的辩解——一点也不满意。





attitude, manner, air

这组词都有“态度、风度”的意思，其区别是：
attitude: 普通用词，指对人或事情的看法和采取的行为，多有某种不很明确或不便明说的感情色彩。
manner: 多指某人在某一场合的言谈举止等。
air: 含义广泛。单数形式指某人脸上表现出的心理活动，或言谈举止；复数形式指某人故意做作而摆出的架子。



fashion, means, approach, way, method, manner, mode

这组词都有“方法、方式”的意思，其区别是：
fashion: 着重独特的程序或方式，尤指个人的偏爱或习惯。
means: 指为达到某种目的或目标而采用的方法、手段或途径。
approach: 指从事某事的特别方法、途径。
way: 普通用词，可指一般的方法，有时也指个人的方法或方式，也可指特殊的方式或方法。
method: 指有系统、有条理地办事或解决问题的方法。
manner: 多指行动的特殊方式或独特的方法。
mode: 书面用词，常指因个人爱好或传统习俗等因素而遵循的方法。



conduct, behavior, manner

这组词都有“行为，举止”的意思，其区别是：
conduct: 较正式用词，泛指某人的行动。侧重根据社会道德标准和责任感。
behavior: 普通用词，侧重指某人在特定场合对他人或在他人面前的行为、举止。
manner: 主要用来指人的习惯行为。


n. 方式；习惯；种类；规矩；风俗
 - way of, mode, category, variety, nature
examples: 英 ['mænə(r)] 美 ['mænər]
n.举止；礼貌；方式；习俗

(1) He is easy in conversation and graceful in manner.(2) There is a noticeable coolness in his manner.(3) It is bad manners to interrupt.(4) He often speaks in the most understated manner possible.(5) He finished off the story in his usual manner.
(1) 他谈吐从容,举止优雅。(2) 在他的举止中表现出一种明显的冷淡。(3) 打断别人说话是不礼貌的。(4) 他说话尽可能保持低调。(5) 他还像往常那样结束了这个故事。
[sound:youdao-70656678-bf650fa3-f30cdccb-1d9e4e1d-d90d5ec5.mp3]

translation:
adj. 用手的; 手制的，手工的; [法]占有的; 体力的
n. 手册; 指南; [乐]键盘; [军]刀枪操练

分布：手册(80%)，指南(8%)，手工的(6%)，键盘(3%)，体力的(3%)


→来自拉丁语manus,手，来自man,手，词源同manure,manufacture.即手制造的，手工的，后引申词义手册等。
手工的n。手册(man手+ual)[man,maun=hand,表示"手"]
a.手的,手工做的,体力的n.手册,指南The manufacturer manually manufactured many machines for the manufactory.制造商为工厂手工制造了很多机器.



adjective  ADVANCED  ■done with the hands 用手做的；手工的
•the manual sorting of letters人工分拣信件

•She tried to cure the pain in my knee by putting manual pressure on the joint.她尝试用手按压我的膝关节来治疗我的膝痛。
 ADVANCED  ■describes a machine that is operated with the hands rather than by electricity or a motor （机器）用手操作的，手动的
•He still works on an old manual typewriter.他还在用一台老式手动打字机。
 ADVANCED  ■involving physical work rather than mental work 体力的
•unskilled manual labour无需技能的体力劳动

•750 manual workers will lose their jobs as a result of company cutbacks.750名体力劳动者将因公司裁员而失业。

•Computer-controlled robots are taking over manual jobs in many industries.在许多行业中，体力工作正逐步由电脑控制的机器人代劳。

['mæn.ju.əl] noun countable ■a book which gives you practical instructions on how to do something or how to use something, such as a machine 使用手册；说明书；指南
•a DIY manual“自己动手做”指南

•The computer comes with a 600-page instruction manual.电脑附有一本600页的操作指南。




adj. 手工的；体力的
 - handmade, mechanic
n. 手册，指南
 - guide, handbook, notebook
examples: 英 ['mænjuəl] 美 ['mænjuəl]
adj.手工的；体力的n.指南；手册；键盘

(1) Work done by machines has replaced manual labour.(2) Making small models requires manual skill.(3) Having grown up in the countryside, I'm used to manual labor.(4) This manual is full of useful tips.(5) A maintenance manual gives diagrams and instructions for repairing your car.(6) This document is meant to serve as a manual for first-time Debian users.
(1) 机器生产已经代替了手工劳作。(2) 制作小模型要手巧。(3) 我生长在农村,习惯体力劳动了。(4) 这本小册子里有很多实用的小建议。(5) 维修手册向您提供修理汽车所需的图表和说明。(6) 本文意在成为Debian的新手的使用手册。

translation:
vt. 制造，生产; 捏造，虚构; 加工; 从事制造
n. 制造; 制成品，产品; 工业，工厂; （文学作品等的）粗制滥造

时态：manufactured, manufacturing, manufactures
分布：制造(92%)，制造业(6%)，捏造(2%)


→manu-,手，-fact,制造。
制造(业)(manu手+fact+ure→手做→制造业(机器发明前用手做))前用的手做))[fac,fact,fect,fic,fig=make,do,表示"做,制作"]
制造;加工(manu+fact做+ure→用手做→制造)[man,maun=hand,表示"手"]
v.制造,加工n.制造,制造业;产品The manufacturer manually manufactured many machines for the manufactory.制造商为工厂手工制造了很多机器.



US [-tʃɚ] verb transitive PRODUCE  制造   ADVANCED  ■to produce goods in large numbers, usually in a factory using machines （通常指工厂利用机械大量）制造，（大批）生产
•He works for a company that manufactures car parts.他在一家生产汽车零件的公司工作。

•The report notes a rapid decline in manufactured goods.报告指出工业产品数量迅速下滑。

UK [ˌmæn.jʊ'fæk.tʃər] US [-tʃɚ] verb transitive INVENT  虚构  ■to invent something, such as an excuse or story, in order to deceive someone 捏造；编造；虚构
•She insisted that every scandalous detail of the story had been manufactured.她坚称报道中每一个骇人听闻的细节都是捏造出来的。

UK [ˌmæn.jʊ'fæk.tʃər] US [-tʃɚ] noun uncountable ■the process of producing goods 生产
•Oil is used in the manufacture of a number of fabrics.石油用作生产多种纺织品。

•The amount of recycled glass used in manufacture doubled in five years.用于制造业的回收玻璃数量在五年间上升了一倍。





manufacture, yield, contribute, create, produce

manufacture: （强调机器成批）生产
yield: 生出、产生或提供（自然产物、结果或利润等）
contribute: 贡献出
create: 引起，造成（感觉或印象）
produce: 制造，引起，导致，带来



manufacture, fabricate, make, produce

这组词都有“做，制造”的意思，其区别是：
manufacture: 正式用词，一般指用机器大规模地批量生产各种生活或生产用品。
fabricate: 特指按照标准样式制作或把材料或部件组合成一个整体。
make: 普通用词，很常用，含义广，既可指制造具体的东西，也可指完成一种行为。
produce: 普通用词，侧重大量地生产出各种生产用品和生活用品。强调结果。也用于引申。



product, manufacture, production, produce

这组词都有“产品，制品”的意思，其区别是：
product: 一般指工业产品，也可泛指各种各样的产品。
manufacture: 一般指机器大量制造的产品。
production: 含义广泛，不同场合有不同的意思，可表示“产品，产物”，尤指人类智力或艺术劳动的产品。
produce: 多指农产品(尤指蔬菜水果等)。


n. 制造；产品；制造业
 - machining, make, work, fabrication
vt. 制造；加工；捏造
 - process, make
examples: 英 [ˌmænju'fæktʃə(r)] 美 [ˌmænju'fæktʃər]
v.（手工）制造；捏造n.制造；制造业；（复）产品

(1) This firm manufactures cars.(2) We manufacture various types of machine tools.(3) You will have to manufacture some kind of excuse.(4) She manufactured a false story to hide the facts.(5) The manufacture of these small components is expensive.(6) The company specializes in the manufacture of quality furniture.(7) These new orders for our manufactures will mean working overtime.
(1) 这家公司生产汽车。(2) 我公司生产各种型号的机床。(3) 你得找些借口。(4) 她编 造瞎话以掩盖事实。(5) 制造这些小部件是非常昂贵的。(6) 那家公司专门制造高质量家具。(7) 这些订购我们产品的新订单意味着要加班。

translation:
n. 制造商，制造厂; 厂主; [经]厂商

分布：制造商(100%)


US [-tʃɚ.ɚ] noun  IMPROVER  countable ■a company that produces goods in large numbers 制造商，生产商（生产大批商品的企业）
•Germany is a major manufacturer of motor cars.德国是汽车生产大国。
manufacturers [plural] ■companies that produce manufactured goods 制造商，生产厂家
•Our kettle was leaking, so we had to send it back to the manufacturers.我们的水壶漏了，要把它退回制造商。




n. [工业] 制造商； [经] 厂商
 - business firm
examples: 英 [ˌmænju'fæktʃərə(r)] 美 [ˌmænju'fæktʃərər]
n.制造商

(1) My husband is now a purse manufacturer.(2) The manufacturer built the machine to order.(3) They bought the machine directly from the manufacturer.(4) She wants to buy direct from the manufacturer and cut out the middleman.
(1) 我先生现在是手提包制造商。(2) 制造商按照定货规格制造了这台机器。(3) 他们直接从厂商那里购买了这台机器。(4) 她想避开分销商直接自厂家买进货物。
[sound:youdao-c69c351c-31d2cb0f-cd7628a7-2ea38c41-3f31e37f.mp3]

translation:
n. 地图，天体图; 类似地图的事物; 〈美俚〉脸，面孔; （染色体上基因排列的）遗传图
vt. 绘制（一地区等的）地图; 勘查; 详细规划; [遗传学]比对

时态：mapped, mapping, maps
分布：地图(96%)，计划(2%)，绘制地图(2%)


→缩写自拉丁语mappa mundi,世界地图，来自mappa,桌布，布料，词源同mop,napkin,apron.因早期地图绘制于布上而得名。mundi,世界的，词源同mundane.
n.地图,图vt.在地图上标示出,绘制地图In the library there is a map of the world.图书馆里有一张世界地图.



noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a drawing of the Earth's surface, or part of that surface, showing the shape and position of different countries, political borders, natural features such as rivers and mountains, and artificial features such as roads and buildings 地图
•a map of the world世界地图

•a map of Paris巴黎地图

•a road map公路图

•We need a large-scale map showing all the footpaths that we can walk along.我们需要一张大比例尺地图，上面要标出所有能走的小路。

•I'm hopeless at map reading (= understanding maps).我一点也看不懂地图。
■a drawing that gives you a particular type of information about a particular area 图（提供某区域特定资讯的图）
•He bought a map showing the population distribution of Scotland.他买了一张苏格兰人口分布图。
■something which shows the position of stars in the sky or the features on the surface of planets （标明恒星位置或行星表面特征的）天体图
•a celestial map天体图

•a map of Mars火星地形图
■a very simple plan which shows a direction of travel between one place and another 示意图
•I'll draw you a quick map if you're worried about finding the hotel.如果你担心找不到那家饭店，我就给你画张简单的示意图。

[mæp] noun countable blow/bomb/wipe, etc. sth off the map ■to destroy a place or thing completely, especially with bombs （尤指用炸弹）彻底毁掉，完全摧毁
•A nuclear bomb could wipe the whole country off the map.一枚核弹就可以毁掉整个国家。

[mæp] noun countable put sth/sb on the map ■to make a thing, person or place famous 使…出名
•The governor has managed to put this sleepy southern state in America on the map.州长终于使美国南部这个死气沉沉的州变得闻名遐迩了。

[mæp] verb transitive (-pp-)■to represent an area of land in the form of a map 绘制…的地图；在地图上标示出
•Parts of the mountainous region in the north of the country have still not been mapped.人们还未为这个国家北部的部分山区绘制地图。

[mæp] verb transitive (-pp-)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] map sth out ■to plan something in detail 详细安排；筹划
•The government has issued a new document mapping out its policies on education.政府发表了一份新档，详细阐述了其教育政策。

•His future is all mapped out ahead of him.他的未来全部都事先筹划好了。





graph, map, chart

这组词都有“地图、图”的意思，其区别是：
graph: 多指用纵横坐标之间关系的曲线表示两个量之间的图表。
map: 指标有国家大小、城市、铁路、河流、山脉、海洋等的地图。
chart: 指航海地图，也指图表。


vt. 映射；计划；绘制地图；确定基因在染色体中的位置
 - schedule, propose, design, project
n. [测] 地图；示意图；染色体图
 - conventional diagram, schematic plan
examples: 英 [mæp] 美 [mæp]
n.地图vt.绘制地图；计划

(1) Paste down the map on the board.(2) I pricked the map with a pin to show our route.(3) It is hard to map all the regions of big countries.(4) So for those types of people, the MAP program is very excellent.(5) It really depends on the map makers and our schedule.
(1) 把这张地图用浆糊贴在布告板上。(2) 我用大头针在地图上扎孔标出我们的路线。(3) 为幅员辽阔的国家绘制地图，想把每个地区都详细标注是件困难的事。(4) 因此对于那些类型的人，地图的计划是非常出色的。(5) 这取决于地图制作者和计划时间表。
[sound:youdao-bf6e06b1-1ffc2177-0b9d3507-ca1981c9-c65ac24d.mp3]

translation:
n. 大理石; 大理石制品; 弹子游戏; 理智，常识
adj. 大理石的; 冷酷无情的; 有大理石花纹的
v. 把（书边）弄上大理石花纹

时态：marbled, marbling, marbles
分布：大理石(99%)，使有大理石的花纹(1%)


→来自古法语marbre的拼写异化形式，来自拉丁语marmor,来自希腊语marmoros,大理石，明亮的石头，可能来自mer,发光，闪光，词源同mere,morning.后用于指用小石子磨成的弹子游戏，但后来随着玻璃技术的成熟，多用于指玻璃弹子。
n.大理石,云石The shark's remark on the marble mark in the market is remarkable.骗子关于市场上大理石标记的评论值得关注.



US ['mɑ:r-] noun ROCK  岩石  uncountable ■a type of very hard rock which has a pattern of lines going through it, feels cold and becomes smooth and shiny when cut and polished 大理石
•a marble floor/statue大理石地板／雕像

UK ['mɑ:.bl] US ['mɑ:r-] noun GLASS BALL  玻璃球  countable ■a small ball usually made of coloured or transparent glass which is used in children's games （儿童游戏中用的）弹子marbles uncountable ■a children's game in which small round glass balls are rolled along the floor 弹子游戏



n. [岩] 大理石；大理石制品；弹珠
 - mable, sarcophagus
adj. [岩] 大理石的；冷酷无情的
 - hard, coldhearted
examples: 英 ['mɑːbl] 美 ['mɑːrbl]
n.大理石；弹子，弹珠vt.使有大理石的花纹
(1) This table is made of marble.(2) Michelangelo carved in marble.(3) There are many perpendicular marble columns in Greek temples.(4) My little son has many marbles.
(1) 这个桌子是大理石的。(2) 米开朗琪罗在大理石上雕刻。(3) 希腊庙宇有很多垂直的大理石柱。(4) 我的小儿子有许多弹珠。
[sound:youdao-394f8efe-b6c159f7-68fb60e2-b7d51a04-7524f345.mp3]

translation:
vi. （坚定地向某地）前进; 行军，进军; 游行示威; 进展，进行
vt. 使前进; 使行军
n. 行进，前进; 行军; 游行示威; 进行曲

时态：marched, marching, marches
分布：三月(57%)，行军(13%)，行进(10%)，前进(7%)，进行曲(7%)，游行示威(4%)，使同行(1%)，进发(1%)


→来自拉丁语Martius mensis,即战神Mars月。比较January,May.march 行进，齐步走，游行示威
n.三月(略作Mar.)The detective detected that the arch was under the marching Arctic architects' protection.侦察察觉拱门受到行进的北极建筑师们的保护.
 march  
v.(使)行军,(使)行进n.行军,行程The detective detected that the arch was under the marching Arctic architects' protection.侦察察觉拱门受到行进的北极建筑师们的保护.



US [mɑ:rtʃ] noun PUBLIC EVENT  公共活动   ADVANCED  countable ■an event in which a large number of people walk through a public place to express their support for something, or their disagreement with or disapproval of something 抗议游行，示威游行
•She's going on a march on Saturday in protest over the closure of the hospital.她将在周六参加一个反对关闭医院的示威游行。

UK [mɑ:tʃ] US [mɑ:rtʃ] noun MUSIC  音乐  countable ■a piece of music with a strong regular rhythm which is written for marching to 进行曲
•a funeral march葬礼进行曲

•Mendelssohn's Wedding March孟德尔颂的《婚礼进行曲》

UK [mɑ:tʃ] US [mɑ:rtʃ] noun SOLDIERS' WALK  行军  countable or uncountable ■a walk, especially by a group of soldiers all walking with the same movement and speed 行走；（尤指）行军，进军
•It had been a long march and the soldiers were weary.这是一次长途行军，士兵都疲惫不堪。

•The border was within a day's march (= distance measured in time taken to walk it).走一天便能到达边境。
on the march ■If soldiers are on the march, they have started marching to a place. 在行军中，在行进中
UK [mɑ:tʃ] US [mɑ:rtʃ] noun CONTINUOUS DEVELOPMENT  持续发展  only singular ■the continuous development of a state, activity or idea 持续的发展
•It is impossible to stop the forward march of progress/time.发展的进程／时间的流逝是无法阻挡的。

•The island is being destroyed by the relentless march of tourism.旅游业的恶性发展正在破坏着这个岛。

UK [mɑ:tʃ] US [mɑ:rtʃ] verb WALK  行走   ADVANCED  intransitive ■to walk somewhere quickly and in a determined way, often because you are angry （常因生气而）快步走
•She marched into my office demanding to know why I hadn't written my report.她冲进我的办公室，质问我为甚么没写报告。
 ADVANCED  intransitive ■to walk through a public place as part of a public event to express support for something, or disagreement with or disapproval of something 抗议游行，示威游行
•Over four thousand people marched through London today to protest against the proposed new law.今天4000多人在伦敦街头游行，抗议新的法律提案。
 ADVANCED  intransitive or transitive ■to walk with regular steps keeping the body stiff, usually in a formal group of people who are all walking in the same way （齐步）行走，行进
•The band marched through the streets.乐队齐步走过街道。

•The soldiers marched 90 miles in three days.那些士兵在三天内行军90英里。

UK [mɑ:tʃ] US [mɑ:rtʃ] verb TAKE FORCEFULLY  强行带走  transitive + adverb or preposition ■to forcefully make someone go somewhere by taking hold of them and pulling them there or going there with them 强迫（某人）一起走；押送
•Without saying a word, she took hold of my arm and marched me off to the headmaster's office.她不发一言，抓着我的手臂就把我强行拉到校长办公室去。

•The police marched a gang of youths out of the building.员警押着一帮年轻人走出了大楼。
⇒ See also frogmarch
UK [mɑ:tʃ] US [mɑ:rtʃ] verb Quick march! ■an order given to soldiers to make them start marching （向士兵发出的命令）齐步走！



n. 行军，进军；进行曲；示威游行
 - demonstration, anabasis
vi. 进军；走过
 - step by, road to
examples: 英 [mɑːtʃ] 美 [mɑːrtʃ]
n.行军；行进；游行示威；稳步前进；进行曲v.行进；前进；进发；使同行；游行示威Marchn.三月

(1) Not a single man fell out in the long march.(2) The army was now on the march to Shanghai.(3) Science is on the march.(4) The peace march attracted a large turnout.(5) This term will begin on March 1st.(6) The troops marched on.(7) The teacher marched the children out to the playground.
(1) 在长途行军中没有一个人掉队。(2) 部队当时正向上海进军。(3) 科学正在进步中。(4) 和平游行吸引了大量的参加者。(5) 这个学期三月一日开始。(6) 部队继续前进。(7) 教师带领孩子们排队去操场。
[sound:youdao-09e59a74-f1f6b07d-bedb426f-5aaf9224-87e1d4d9.mp3]

translation:
n. 边缘，范围; 极限; 利润，盈余; （版心外）的空白
vt. 留边; 成为…的边; 加边于，围绕; 为…加旁注

分布：利润(38%)，边缘(32%)，幅度(9%)，余地(7%)，页边空白(4%)，差额(4%)，加边于(3%)，定金(2%)，为…付保证金(1%)


→来自拉丁语marginem,边缘，边界，来自merg,记号，标记，边界，词源同mark,march.引申词义湖边，河边，页边等。
n.页边空白;边缘;余地;幅度Pandas are on the margin of extinction.大熊猫已濒临绝种.
【参】marginal（adj 记在页边的；不重要的）



US ['mɑ:r-] noun countable DIFFERENCE  差额   ADVANCED  ■the amount by which one thing is different from another 差数，差额
