translation:
n. 中部，中间，当中
prep. 在…中间（等于amidst）
adv. 在中间，在中央

分布：中间(60%)，当中(40%)


→来自mid,中间的，-s,所有格后缀，-t,寄生字母。比较against.
n.中间,当中They were in the midst of a crisis.他们处于危急存亡之际.



noun uncountable formal ■the middle of a group of people or things 中间，当中，中央
•She caught sight of Johnny in their midst (= among them) , laughing and talking.她看到强尼在他们当中，又说又笑。
in the midst of sth ■in the middle of an event, situation or activity 正当…的时候；在…之中
•I'm afraid I'm too busy - I'm in the midst of writing up a report.恐怕我太忙了——我正在写一份报告。

•The country is in the midst of an economic crisis.这个国家正在经历一场经济危机。

[mɪdst] [mɪtst] preposition literary ■among 
•The summit of the mountain appeared midst the clouds.山顶在云中显现。





midst, center, heart, core, middle

这组词都有“中心”的意思，其区别是：
midst: 书面语用词，指在一个群体的深处或在某活动的进程中。
center: 指三维空间的中心点，也可比喻抽象事物的中心。
heart: 指事物最内部或最重要的部分，表地理位置时可与center换用。
core: 指某事物固定的中心部分或最重要的核心部分。比喻意义指某物的精华。
middle: 一般指时间、空间或过程两端间等距的部分。


n. 当中，中间
 - middle
prep. 在…中间（等于amidst）
 - among, in the middle of
examples: 英 [mɪdst] 美 [mɪdst]
n.中间；当中prep.在 ... 当中(=amidst)

(1) He was but recently in our midst.(2) In his escape, he walked six days in the midst of howling wilderness.(3) We must weed out the traitors in our midst!(4) The girls had got on well together until the apple of discord in the person of a handsome young man arrived in their midst.(5) There is one white tulip in the midst of the red ones.(6) So Paul went out from their midst.(7) There is one white tulip in the midst of the red ones.
(1) 他只是最近才到我们中间。(2) 在逃亡期间，他在人迹罕至的旷野中走了6天。(3) 我们必须清除我们中间的叛徒!(4) 姑娘们一直相处很好，后来一个英俊的小伙子来到她们中间，引起了她们之间的不和。(5) 在一片红色郁金香当中有一朵白色的。(6) 于是保罗从他们当中出去了。(7) 在一片红色郁金香当中有一朵白色的。
[sound:youdao-d0ff3974-fb8fe97f-44f69703-86ec83d8-ac73323b.mp3]

translation:
aux. 表示可能; 表示许可; 表示询问情况
n. 力气; 力量; 威力; 权力
v. 可以; 应该

分布：可能(71%)，也许(21%)，威力(4%)，力量(4%)


→来自古英语miht,来自Proto-Germanic*makhti,来自magh,使能够，赋予力量，词源同may,magic.引申词义强大力量，威力。后用于助动词表也许。比较may.
aux.v.可能,也许n.力量,威力,权力Conversely, you might say that it is ridiculous.反过来说,你可以说它很古怪.



modal verb MAY  可能   ESSENTIAL  past simple of ■the verb may , used especially when reporting what someone has said, thought, asked, etc （may 的过去式）可能，可以
•I brought him some sandwiches because I thought he might be hungry.我拿了些三明治给他，因为我想他可能饿了。

•Very politely the little boy asked if he might have another piece of cake (= he said "May I have another piece of cake, please?").小男孩非常礼貌地问可否再吃一块蛋糕。

[maɪt] modal verb POSSIBILITY  可能性   ESSENTIAL  ■used to express the possibility that something will happen or be done, or that something is true although not very likely （表示可能性）可能，也许
•I might come and visit you in America next year, if I can save enough money.如果我存够钱的话，明年我也许会到美国看你。

•Don't go any closer - it might be dangerous/it mightn't be safe.别再走近了——那可能很危险／不安全。

•Driving so fast, he might have had a nasty accident (= it could have happened but it did not).他开车开得那么快，早就可能出意外。

•The rain might have stopped by now.现在雨也许已经停了。

[maɪt] modal verb PERMISSION  允许   ADVANCED  UK formal ■used as a more polite form of may when asking for permission （用于请求许可，语气较 may 更婉转）可以，能
•Might I ask a question?我能问个问题吗？

•I wonder if I might have a quick look at your newspaper?请问我能否看一下你的报纸？

[maɪt] modal verb SUGGESTION  建议   ADVANCED  ■used to make a suggestion or suggest a possibility in a polite way （用于礼貌地建议）可以，也许
•You might like to try a little more basil in the sauce next time.下次你可以试着在酱汁里多加点罗勒。

•I thought you might like to join me for dinner.我想你也许愿意和我一起吃晚餐。

[maɪt] modal verb SHOULD  应该  ■used to suggest, especially angrily, what someone should do to be pleasant, correct, polite, etc （表示婉转的责备）应该
•You might at least try to look like you're enjoying yourself!你至少应该努力做出很开心的样子！

•"I've asked the boss to dinner tonight." "Well, you might have warned me!"“今晚我要请老板吃饭。”“噢，你总该事先告诉我！”

[maɪt] modal verb INTRODUCE  引出  (also may) ■used to introduce a statement which is very different from the statement you really want to make, in order to compare the two （用于引出与真正想说的话完全不同的话，以将两者对比）也许
•Leeds might be an excellent team, but today they played appallingly.里兹队也许是支很棒的球队，但今天他们表现得糟糕极了。

[maɪt] modal verb I might have known slightly disapproving ■said when you are not surprised at a situation or someone's behaviour, because you expected it 我就知道
•I might have known (that) he'd still be in bed at noon.我就知道他到中午了还在睡觉。

[maɪt] modal verb might I ask/inquire/know UK formal ■used in questions to show disapproval by being more polite than is expected （用于问句中，礼貌地表示不赞同）我可以问一下／知道吗
•And what are you doing in there, might I ask?我可以问一下你在那里做甚么吗？

[maɪt] modal verb   Common Learner Errors   mightMight  is followed by an infinitive verb without 'to'.Don't say 'might does something', say might do something :✗ This year's group might includes several vegetarians.This year's group might include several vegetarians.
[maɪt] noun uncountable ■power, strength or force 力量；威力；能力
•Pizarro defeated the might of the Inca Empire with only a few hundred men.皮萨罗以区区几百人就打败了强大的印加帝国。

•She struggled with all her might to get free.她用尽全力想挣脱出来。

[maɪt] noun uncountable with might and main old-fashioned literary■with as much effort as possible 全力以赴，竭尽全力
•They shouted with might and main but nobody came to rescue them.他们竭尽全力呼喊，却没有人来营救。





might, strength, power, vigour, force, energy

这组词都有“力”的意思，其区别是：
might: 多指巨大或超人的力量。
strength: 指机体内部的能力，是依靠身体组织而存在的力，经使用就变为force。
power: 最普通用词，泛指一切力量或能力等。
vigour: 指由生命元气的存在所产生的活力、精力。
force: 着重指克服障碍，推动人或物朝所要求的方向运动或能产生明显效应的力量。
energy: 用于人时，指工作时焕发出的精力或干劲。


n. 力量；威力；势力
 - strength, force, muscle, power, influence
aux. 可能；也许
 - should
examples: 英 [maɪt] 美 [maɪt]
aux.可能；也许；may的过去式n.威力；力量

(1) That might be in your favor.(2) You might do me a favor?(3) If someone had been with him, he might not have been drowned.(4) The boy might have known the truth, but I am not quite sure.(5) We fear the military might of the enemy.(6) To be frank, this mission is beyond my might.(7) He fought back with all his might.
(1) 那可能对你有利。(2) 你或许能帮我—个忙吧?(3) 如果有人在他旁边，或许他就不会溺死。(4) 这男孩当时也许知道真相，但我不很确定。(5) 我们惧怕敌人强大的军事力量。(6) 说实话，这一使命非我能力所及。(7) 他倾全力反击。
[sound:youdao-ef79c982-0bb0d36e-7a66227a-c0a9ec80-4ed08188.mp3]

translation:
adj. 温柔的; 温暖的; 轻微的; （味道）不浓的
n. 淡味麦芽啤酒

级别：milder, mildest
分布：温和的(85%)，柔和的(8%)，宽大的(5%)，清淡的(2%)


→来自mel,软的，词源同mill,meld,melt.引申词义温和的，温柔的，轻微的等。
a.温和的,轻微的,味淡的,不含有害物质的的In the building, the wild child hurt his mild chin on the china.在大楼里,那个粗野的孩子在瓷器上弄伤了温柔的下巴.
【参】mildew（n 霉；v 发霉）mil温和，dew露珠：使东西发霉。Milestone（n 里程碑）mile公里，stone石头【反】acute（adj 敏锐的；急性的）



adjective SLIGHT  轻微的   ADVANCED  ■not violent, severe or extreme 温和的；和缓的；轻微的
•She can't accept even mild criticism of her work.即使别人对她的作品略有微词，她也不能接受。

•He has suffered a mild heart attack - nothing too serious.他只是轻微的心脏病发作，并不太严重。

[maɪld] adjective WEATHER  天气   ADVANCED  ■describes weather that is not very cold or not as cold as usual （天气）温和的，暖和的
•We've had a mild winter this year.我们今年过了个暖冬。

[maɪld] adjective FOOD  食物   ADVANCED  ■describes food or a food flavour that is not very strong （食物或其味道）不浓烈的，淡的
•He doesn't like a hot curry - he prefers a mild one.他不喜欢辛辣的咖喱饭，而较喜欢味淡一点的。

•a mild chilli sauce微辣的辣椒酱

[maɪld] adjective GENTLE  温和的  ■gentle and calm 温和的，随和的
•a shy, mild sort of guy害羞、温和的人

[maɪld] noun uncountable ■a dark beer, drunk in some parts of Britain, that does not have a very strong or bitter taste （英国一些地区的）清淡黑啤酒 Compare bitter




gentle, moderate, tender, mild, soft

这组词都有“温和的，柔和的”的意思，其区别是：
gentle: 指温柔、亲切、优雅。常含有节制和意味。
moderate: 中性词，指温和稳健，有节制，不走极端。
tender: 和gentle意思很接近。指人的感情细腻、温情慈爱和有同情心，侧重心理素质。也可指物的柔嫩等。
mild: 用于人时，指天性温顺，脾气好，不放肆粗野；用于物时，主要指适度，程度上相当缓和给人以愉快感觉。
soft: 侧重柔软或安稳、光滑，使人不感到粗糙或严酷。


adj. 温和的；轻微的；淡味的；文雅的；不含有害物质的的
 - pacific, gentle, moderate, soft, slight
examples: 英 [maɪld] 美 [maɪld]
adj.温和的；柔和的；宽大的；清淡的

(1) He has a mild nature.(2) He gave a mild answer, in spite of his anger.(3) The coastal area has very mild winter, but by contrast the central plains become extremely cold.(4) The patient has a mild fever.(5) The punishment inflicted on them was too mild.(6) This cheese is very mild.
(1) 他的性格温和。(2) 尽管他十分恼火,他还是态度温和地回答了。(3) 靠近海岸的地区有很温和的冬天,相比而方,靠近中央的平原就变得非常寒冷。(4) 那个病人有些轻微的发烧。(5) 他们受的惩罚太轻。(6) 这种奶酪味道清淡。

translation:
n. 英里; 很远的距离; 一英里赛跑

分布：英里(93%)，一英里赛跑(4%)，海里(3%)


→来自拉丁语milia,一千，词源同million,millimeter.后引申词义英里，即一千整步，两千小步。
n.英里,哩,海里Having piled miles of files, the compiler smiled a while at the profile.堆了几英里长的文件之后,编辑对着侧面笑了一会.



noun  ESSENTIAL  countable ■a unit of distance equal to 1760 yards or 1.6 kilometres 英里（长度单位，相当于1760码或1.6公里）
•a ten-mile drive10英里的车程

•The nearest town is ten miles away.最近的城镇在十英里外。

•The speed limit is 30 miles an/per hour.限速为每小时30英里。
miles [plural] ■a very long way 很远的距离
•From the top, we could see for miles in every direction.从顶部我们可以环视四周，极目远眺。

•He lives miles away on the other side of town.他住在城的另一边，离这里很远。

[maɪl] noun be miles away mainly UK ■to not be conscious of what is happening around you because you are thinking about something else 心不在焉
•You could tell by the expression on her face that she was miles away, thinking about home.从她的表情你就可以看出她心不在焉，在想家呢。

[maɪl] noun a mile a minute ■very quickly 迅速地
•Mike was very excited talking a mile a minute.麦克很兴奋，说话像连珠炮。

[maɪl] noun a mile off ■If you can see or realize something a mile off, you notice it easily and quickly 一下子，很容易（就能注意到…）
•She's lying - you can tell it a mile off.她在撒谎——一眼就能看得出来。

[maɪl] noun (by) miles informal ■used to say something is much greater or better than something else （大或好）很多；…得多
•British restaurant food is better by miles/miles better than it used to be 20 years ago.英国餐厅的食物比20年前的好多了。

[maɪl] noun miles from anywhere/nowhere ■a long distance from other houses or a town 荒郊野外，偏远的地方
•They live miles from nowhere, in the middle of the countryside.他们住在远离人烟的乡下。

[maɪl] noun miles too big/small/expensive, etc. informal ■very much bigger/smaller/more expensive, etc. than you would like 实在太大／小／贵等
•This tea is miles too sweet!这茶实在太甜了！

[maɪl] noun stand/stick out a mile ■to be very obvious or easy to see 一目了然，显而易见
•His lack of experience sticks out a mile.他缺乏经验，这显而易见。
examples: 英 [maɪl] 美 [maɪl]
n.英里；海里；一英里赛跑

(1) My son hoofs a mile to school each day.(2) It's not less than a mile to the station.(3) He had come up from deep down in the water as the dark cloud of blood had settled and dispersed in the mile deep sea.(4) He wants to better his record for running the mile.
(1) 我的儿子每天步行一英里去上学。(2) 到火车站至少有一英里路。(3) 鱼深暗色的血在一哩深的海里，像云朵般地扩散开来，鲨鱼闻到血腥味便由深水中游过来。(4) 他要提高一英里赛跑的纪录。
[sound:youdao-2ee983a8-99dd1cc0-6f0cf292-7f44cc9b-e34fbdef.mp3]

translation:
adj. 军事的; 军用的; 讨厌的; 好战的
n. 军人; 军队; 武装力量

分布：军队(83%)，军事的(17%)


→来自拉丁语militaris,战士的，战争的，来自miles,战士，可能来自希腊语homilos,集会人群，队伍，来自sem,一，一起，词源同same,assembly.
军人的,军队的(milit+ary)[milit=soldier,表示"兵"]
a.军事的,军用的,军队的In the library, arbitrary the librarian wrote the auxiliary diary about military literature.在图书馆,武断的图书管理员写下了有关军事文学的辅助日记.
【记】mili米粒，吃米粒长大的人－军人【参】militia（n 民兵）



US [-ter.i] adjective  ESSENTIAL  ■relating to or belonging to the armed forces 军事的；军用的
•foreign military intervention外国军事干预

•military targets/forces军事目标／力量

•military uniform军装
 ESSENTIAL  ■describes a characteristic that is typical of the armed forces 富有军队特点的
•military precision军事行动般的精确

UK ['mɪl.ɪ.tri] US [-ter.i] noun the military  IMPROVER  ■the armed forces 武装部队；军方
•The military has opposed any cuts in defence spending.军方反对任何裁减国防开支的举措。




adj. 军事的；军人的；适于战争的
 - martial, soldierly
n. 军队；军人
 - force, soldier, battalion
examples: 英 ['mɪlətri] 美 ['mɪləteri]
adj.军事的n.军队
(1) They are making further efforts to decrease military spending.(2) The military were called in to deal with the riot.(3) The military has tightened its hold on the country.
(1) 他们正在做进一步的努力来减少军费开支。(2) 已将军队调来镇压暴乱。(3) 军方加强了对这个国家的控制。
[sound:youdao-52c0b67a-2dbf04b5-ac6d0e84-9b041298-f3ccf70a.mp3]

translation:
n. 磨坊; 磨粉机; 榨汁机; 工厂
vt. 研磨，粉碎; 搅拌; 磨，铣; 轧花边（在纸币上）
vi. 惊跑，乱闯; 经研磨

时态：milled, milling, mills
分布：磨(56%)，工厂(22%)，磨坊(16%)，磨粉机(5%)，碾碎(1%)


→来自希腊语molere,磨，来自mel,软，锤打，磨，词源同mallet,melt.引申词义磨坊，磨石，因磨坊在农业社会是比较有代表性的工业产品，后借用该词来指现代意义上的工厂。
n.磨粉机,磨坊;作坊,工厂The drawer put the strawberries and raw paws into a drawer in the saw-mill.绘图者把草莓和生熊掌放进锯板厂的抽屉里.
【记】m妈妈，ill：妈妈生病了，是因为在磨房里面工作得过渡劳累了。



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a building where grain is crushed into flour 磨坊，碾磨厂，磨粉厂 ADVANCED  ■a small machine for crushing things into powder 碾磨机，磨粉机
•a pepper/coffee mill胡椒／咖啡研磨机
 ADVANCED  ■a factory where a particular substance is produced 制造厂，工厂
•a cotton/paper/steel mill棉纺／造纸／炼钢厂

[mɪl] noun countable put sb through the mill informal ■to cause someone to have a difficult and unpleasant experience, especially by asking them a lot of difficult questions 使（某人）饱受折磨；（尤指用大量问题）为难（某人）
•I had the interview this morning - they really put me through the mill.我今早去面试了——他们真的让我受了几番折磨。

[mɪl] verb transitive ■to crush grain into flour or another substance into powder 磨；碾碎
•The grain is still milled locally.谷物仍然在当地碾磨。
■specialized ■to shape metal by removing parts from it using a special machine 铣（金属）
[mɪl] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   mill around (UK also mill about) ■If a group of people mill around, they move about with no particular purpose or in no fixed direction, sometimes while waiting for someone （一群人）漫无目的地乱转，闲荡
•In the village square, people were milling about in the sunshine.在村庄广场上，人们在阳光下徜徉。





plant, mill, factory, works

这组词都有“工厂”的意思，其区别是：
plant: 多指电力或机械制造方面的工厂。
mill: 原义指粮食加工厂。现多指轻工业类的工厂。
factory: 最普通用词，可泛指任何制造产品的地方。
works: 多指钢铁等重工业方面的工厂，也指一些特定的厂。


n. [工经] 工厂；磨坊； [化工]  [粮食]  [机] 磨粉机；制造厂；压榨机
 - factory, plant, work
vt. 搅拌； [机] 碾磨；磨细；使乱转
 - mix round, churn up
examples: 英 [mɪl] 美 [mɪl]
n.磨坊；工厂；磨粉机v.碾碎；磨；（使）乱转

(1) He sends his crop to a large mill instead of grinding it himself.(2) The logs are drifted downstream to the mill.(3) Com is ground into flour in a mill.(4) He used a miller to mill the grain into flour.(5) The special milling machine to mill long key-groove(6) Cattle sometimes mill about when they are frightened.
(1) 他把收获的庄稼送到大磨坊去，而不是自己碾磨。(2) 那些原木沿河顺水漂到工厂。(3) 谷物在磨粉机里磨成粉。(4) 他用碾磨机把谷物磨成面粉。(5) 一种铣削长键槽的专用机床(6) 牛群在受惊时，有时会乱动。
[sound:youdao-65ae2a5a-f591f134-135988ce-899d8b75-ac111c61.mp3]

translation:
n. 毫米

分布：毫米(100%)


US [-tˌɚ] noun countable (written abbreviation mm)  IMPROVER  ■a unit of length which is equal to 0.001 metres 毫米



n. 毫米；公厘
 - strich, milimetre
examples: 英 ['mɪlimiːtə(r)] 美 ['mɪlimiːtər]
n.毫米=millimeter(美).
(1) The deviation is reduced to one millimetre.(2) One second of arc movement is one thirtieth of a millimetre.
(1) 偏差减为一毫米。(2) 一弧秒的移动是一毫米的三十分之一。

translation:
n. 百万
adj. 百万的; 无数的

分布：百万(60%)，百万的(16%)，无数的(16%)，群众(8%)


→来自拉丁语mille,一千，-on,大词后缀。字面意思即好多个一千，大千，后由抽象数词过渡到固定数词。比较hundred,thousand.
num./n.百万,百万个The skilful miller killed millions of lions with his ski.技术娴熟的磨坊主用雪橇杀死了上百万头狮子.



number (plural million or millions) ESSENTIAL  countable ■the number 1 000 000 （数字）100万
•She got eight million dollars for appearing in that film.她出演那部电影拿到了800万美元的片酬。
a million/millions of sth informal ■a large number 大量
•I must have told you a million times to close the windows when you leave the house.我一定已经告诉你无数次了，离开房子前要把窗户关好。
the millions ■numbers between 1 000 000 and 1 000 000 000 一百万与十亿间的数字
•In wealthy parts of the country, homes cost from £ 750 000 into the millions.在这个国家的富裕地区，房屋的价钱从75万到数百万英镑不等。

['mɪl.jən] number (plural million or millions)be one in a million approving ■to be a very special person 是万中无一的人，是无与伦比的人
•Thanks again - you're one in a million!再次感谢——你真是个难得的好人！

['mɪl.jən] number (plural million or millions)one-in-a-million ■describes a chance that is extremely unlikely 可能性极小的
•Don't worry - the chances of anything going wrong are one-in-a-million.别担心——出问题的可能性极小。

['mɪl.jən] number (plural million or millions)look / feel (like) a million dollars (US look/feel (like) a million bucks) informal ■to look or feel extremely good, often because you are experiencing something that costs a lot of money （通常指享受奢侈品时）看起来／感觉非常好
•"You look a million dollars in that dress, honey!"“你穿那件衣服真棒，亲爱的！”

['mɪl.jən] number (plural million or millions)thanks a million informal ■thank you very much 非常感谢
•"I've done what you asked." "Thanks a million!"“你要我做的事我已经做完了。”“非常感谢！”

['mɪl.jən] number (plural million or millions)  Common Learner Errors   millions (of sth) or million?When million  is used after a particular number, it is used in the singular form and without 'of'.Don't say 'five/ten/fifteen millions of sth', say five/ten/fifteen  million sth:✗ The house cost 2 millions of dollars.The house cost 2 million dollars.When million  is used without a particular number, it is used in the plural form and is sometimes followed by 'of':The house cost millions (of dollars).



n. [数] 百万；无数
 - mega, innumerability
adj. [数] 百万的；无数的
 - thousand, countless, infinite
examples: 英 ['mɪljən] 美 ['mɪljən]
n.百万；群众adj.无数的；百万的
(1) It is estimated that the damage was over one million dollars.(2) The old man left an estate of two million dollars when he died.(3) There were millions of people in the square.
(1) 据估计，损失超过了一百万元。(2) 那老人去世时留下二百万美元的遗产。(3) 广场上有好多好多人。

translation:
n. 心，精神，心力，知，智力，智慧; 心胸，头脑，人; 愿望，目的，意向，意志，决心，见解，意见; 记忆，记性，记忆力，回想
vi. 介意; 注意
vt. 专心于; 介意; 愿意做; 照顾

时态：minded, minding, minds
分布：心(41%)，介意(24%)，头脑(11%)，想法(6%)，注意(5%)，精神(4%)，记忆(3%)，理智(2%)，专心于(2%)，意见(1%)，照顾(1%)


→来自men,思想，思考，记忆，词源同man,mental,monitor.引申词义思维，头脑等。mind 思想，思维，头脑
n.精神,理智,意见,记忆力v.注意,介意,反对He has a creative mind.他具有创造力的头脑.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■the part of a person that makes it possible for a person to think, feel emotions and understand things 头脑；大脑
•Her mind was full of what had happened the night before, and she just wasn't concentrating.她脑海里满是前一天晚上所发生的事情，根本无法集中精神。

•Of course I'm telling the truth - you've got such a suspicious mind!我当然是在说实话——你太疑神疑鬼了！

•I just said the first thing that came into my mind.我只是想到甚么就说甚么。

•I'm not quite clear in my mind about what I'm doing.我没太意识到自己在做甚么。
■a very clever person 聪明人，有才智的人
•She was one of the most brilliant minds of the last century.她是上世纪才智最为出众的人物之一。
all in the/ your mind ■describes a problem that does not exist and is only imagined 全是心理作用的；只是凭空想像的
•His doctor tried to convince him that he wasn't really ill and that it was all in the mind.医生努力想让他相信他其实没有生病，只是心理作用罢了。
bear/keep sth in mind ■to remember a piece of information when you are making a decision or thinking about a matter 记住
•Bearing in mind how young she is, I thought she did really well.别忘了她年纪是那么小，我认为她做得很棒了。

•Of course, repair work is expensive and you have to keep that in mind.当然，维修费很昂贵，你必须记住这一点。
go over sth in your mind (also turn sth over in your mind) ■to think repeatedly about an event that has happened 反覆思考
•She would go over the accident again and again in her mind, wishing that she could somehow have prevented it.她不断地想起那次意外，希望当时要是能做点甚么来避免就好了。

[maɪnd] noun countable be bored/drunk, etc. out of your mind informal ■to be extremely bored/drunk, etc. 非常厌烦／喝得烂醉
[maɪnd] noun countable be of sound/unsound mind legal ■to not be mentally ill/to be mentally ill 心智健全／精神失常
[maɪnd] noun countable be of the same mind (also be of one mind) ■to have the same opinion 意见一致，想法相同
•We're of the same mind on most political issues.在大多数政治问题上我们意见一致。

[maɪnd] noun countable bring/call sth to mind ■to remember something 想起，记起
•I can see his face, but I just can't bring his name to mind.我能认出他的脸，只是我记不起他的名字了。

[maɪnd] noun countable get your mind round something ■to succeed in understanding something difficult or strange 弄懂（复杂或奇怪的事）
•I find it hard to get my mind round such complex issues.我发现自己很难弄懂这样复杂的问题。

[maɪnd] noun countable get sth out of your mind ■to make yourself stop thinking about something 忘掉，不再去想
•I can't get that dreadful moment/image out of my mind.我忘不了那可怕的一刻／景象。

[maɪnd] noun countable have sth on your mind ■to be worrying about something 有心事；牵挂；担心
•Paul's got a lot on his mind at the moment.保罗此刻心事重重。

[maɪnd] noun countable have a mind of its own mainly humorous ■A machine or other object can be said to have a mind of its own if it seems to be controlling the way it behaves or moves, independently of the person using it （机器或其他物品）有主见，自行其事
•This shopping trolley has a mind of its own.这辆购物手推车自己还挺有主意的。

[maɪnd] noun countable have half a mind /a good mind to do sth ■to think that you might do something, often because something has annoyed you 可能会做…／真想做…
•I've a good mind to go without him if he's going to be such a bore!如果他这么令人厌烦，我真不想让他一起去。

[maɪnd] noun countable have something in mind ■to have a plan or intention 想好，考虑到
•Did you have anything in mind for Helen's present?你想好为海伦准备甚么礼物了吗？

[maɪnd] noun countable in your mind's eye ■in your imagination or memory 在（某人）脑海中；在（某人）记忆里
•In my mind's eye, she remains a little girl of six although she's actually a grown woman.尽管实际上她已是成年女子，但在我的心目中她仍是个六岁的小女孩。

[maɪnd] noun countable a load / weight off your mind ■when a problem which has been worrying you stops or is dealt with 卸下了思想上的重负，放下了心头大石
•I'm so relieved that I don't have to do the after-dinner speech - it's such a weight off my mind!饭后不必作演讲使我舒了一口长气——我终于放下了心头大石！

[maɪnd] noun countable make up your mind (also make your mind up)  ADVANCED  ■to decide 下定决心，打定主意
•I haven't made up my mind where to go yet.我还没打定主意去哪里。

[maɪnd] noun countable your mind is a blank/goes blank ■When your mind is a blank/goes blank, you cannot remember a particular thing, or you cannot remember anything 脑海里一片空白；记不起
•I tried to remember her name, but my mind went a complete blank.我努力想记起她的名字，但脑袋里一片空白。

[maɪnd] noun countable your mind is on sth ■When your mind is on something, you think about it or give attention to it 心思在…上
•I couldn't concentrate on my work - my mind was on other things.我无法集中精神工作——我的心思在别的事情上。

•My mind wasn't on what he was saying, so I'm afraid I missed half of it.我的心思并不在他所说的话上，所以恐怕漏听了一半的内容。

[maɪnd] noun countable mind over matter ■the power of the mind to control and influence the body and the physical world generally 精神高于物质
•He announced what he called 'the ultimate test of mind over matter' - a woman walking over hot coals.他宣布将进行他称为“精神高于物质的终极测试”——让一名女子在炙热的炭火上行走。

[maɪnd] noun countable out of your mind ■unable to behave or deal with things normally because something has made you very worried, unhappy or angry （因忧虑、不高兴或愤怒而）精神错乱，发狂
•She was out of her mind with grief.她因悲伤而精神错乱。

•I'd go out of my mind if I had to do her job all day!要是让我整天做她的工作，我会发疯的！
 informal ■extremely stupid or mentally ill 犯傻的；发疯的
•You must be out of your mind paying £200 for one night in a hotel!花200英镑在饭店住一晚，你一定是发疯了！

[maɪnd] noun countable put you in mind of sth ■to cause you to remember something 使（某人）想起
•The mention of skiing holidays put me in mind of a travelogue that I saw last week.提到滑雪假期使我想起上周看过的一部旅行纪录片。

[maɪnd] noun countable put sth out of your mind ■to force yourself not to think about something 把…忘掉，把…抛诸脑后
•It's over, put it out of your mind.一切都结束了，把它忘掉吧。

[maɪnd] noun countable set / put sb's mind at rest / ease ■to stop someone from worrying about something 让（某人）放心，使（某人）安心
•Chris phoned to say they'd arrived safely, so that really put my mind at rest.克里斯打电话来说他们已经安全抵达，这下子我真的放心了。

[maɪnd] noun countable set/put your mind to sth ■to decide you are going to do something and to put a lot of effort into doing it 决心要，一心想
•If you'd just put your mind to it, I'm sure you could do it.如果你一心一意的去做，我肯定你能完成。

[maɪnd] noun countable sb's state/frame of mind ■the way someone feels about their life or situation at the moment （某人）的精神状态
•He's in a much more positive state/frame of mind these days.近来他的精神状态好多了。

[maɪnd] noun countable take sb's mind off sth ■to stop you from worrying or thinking about a problem or pain, often by forcing you to think about other things 使（某人）暂时忘记（忧虑之事）；转移（某人）对（问题、疼痛等）的注意
•The good thing about running is that it takes my mind off any problems I've got.跑步的好处在于它能使我暂时忘记自己遇到的问题。

[maɪnd] noun countable to my mind ■in my opinion 我认为，在我看来
•He's got pink walls and a green carpet, which to my mind looks all wrong.他把墙壁刷成了粉红色，铺了一块绿色的地毯，我觉得这根本不相配。

[maɪnd] verb OPPOSE  反对   ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■(used in questions and negatives) to be annoyed or worried by something （用于疑问句和否定句）介意，反对
•Do you think he'd mind if I borrowed his book?你认为他会介意我借他的书吗？

•[+ -ing verb] I don't mind having a dog in the house so long as it's clean.我不反对房里有只狗，只要它干净就行了。

•informal I wouldn't mind (= I would like) something to eat, actually.其实我不介意吃点东西。

•Would you mind turning (= Please would you turn) your radio down a little please?请你将收音机的声音调小一些好吗？

•Do you mind if (= May) I put the television on?你介意我打开电视吗？

•[+ obj + -ing verb] Do you mind me smoking ?我抽烟你介意吗？

•[+ question word] I don't mind wh at you wear so long as it's not that awful pink shirt.你穿甚么我都不介意，只要不是那件难看的粉红色衬衫就好了。

•I'd prefer to stay in tonight, if you don't mind.如果你不反对，今晚我宁愿呆在家中。

•mainly UK "Would you like tea or coffee?" "I don't mind - either."“你喝茶还是咖啡？”“随便──都可以。”
Do you mind? ■said to someone when you feel annoyed with them for what they have just done or said （对某人的言行表示恼火）你怎么回事？你别这样好不好？
•Do you mind? That's my seat you're sitting on!你怎么回事？你坐了我的座位！
■
mind 1	  Common Learner Errors   mindRemember: mind  is usually followed by a verb in the -ing  form.Don't say 'mind to do something', say mind doing something :✗ Would you mind to send me an up-to-date catalogue?Would you mind sending me an up-to-date catalogue?
[maɪnd] verb BE CAREFUL  小心   ADVANCED  transitive mainly UK ■to be careful of, or give attention to something 小心，当心；注意
•[+ (that)] Mind that box - the bottom isn't very strong.小心那个盒子——盒底不是很牢固。

•Mind (that) you don't bang your head on the shelf when you stand up.站起来时小心头别撞到架子上。

•Mind (= Make certain that) you take enough money with you.确保一定要带上足够的钱。

•old-fashioned Mind your language (= Don't use swear words) , young lady!注意你的措辞，小姐！
Mind (out)! mainly UK ■used to tell someone to move or be careful, or to warn them of danger 当心！
•Mind out! We're coming through with the stretcher.当心！我们正抬着担架走过来。

•'Hey, mind!' he said when she trod on his foot.当她踩到他的脚时，他说：“嘿，小心点！”

•Mind out for falling rocks on this part of the trail.走这段小路时要当心落石。
mind how you go mainly UK UK informal ■said when you say goodbye to someone, meaning 'take care' （道别用语）您慢走，您走好
[maɪnd] verb TAKE CARE OF  照顾  transitive ■to take care of someone or something 照料，照顾；看管
•She asked me if I'd mind the children for an hour while she went shopping.她问我她去买东西时我能否照顾孩子一个小时。

•Could you mind my bag for a moment while I go to the toilet?我去洗手间时你能看管一下我的袋子吗？

[maɪnd] verb don't mind me ■said to tell someone who is in the same room as you not to pay any attention to you, because you do not want to interrupt what they are doing 不用管我，当我不在眼前好了
•Don't mind me - I'm just sorting out some files here.不用管我——我只是在这里整理些档。

[maɪnd] verb I don't mind if I do ■said to politely accept an offer of food or drink （用于礼貌地接受）可以吃点，可以喝些
•"There's plenty more cake if you'd like another piece." "I don't mind if I do."“如果你想再吃一块，这里还有很多蛋糕呢。”“那我就不客气了。”

[maɪnd] verb if you don't mind me saying ■used as a polite way to begin a criticism （用于礼貌地提出批评）如果你不介意我说
•If you don't mind me saying (so), I think the curry could be a little hotter next time.如果你不介意的话，我认为下次煮咖喱不妨煮得更辣一点。

[maɪnd] verb mind (you) ■used when you want to make what you have just said sound less strong （用于缓和刚才说过的话）尽管如此，不过嘛，请注意
•He's very untidy about the house; mind you, I'm not much better.他很不注意房子的整洁，不过呢，我也不比他好多少。

•I know I'm lazy - I did go swimming yesterday, mind.我知道我很懒——可我昨天确实去游泳了。

[maɪnd] verb mind your own business (abbreviation MYOB) informal mainly humorous ■used to tell someone in a rude way that you do not want them to ask about something private 多管闲事，管好你自己的事
•"Where have you been?" "Mind your own business!"“你去哪里了？”“多管闲事！”

[maɪnd] verb mind your p's and q's old-fashioned ■to make an effort to be especially polite in a particular situation 注意自己的言谈举止
•I have to mind my p's and q's when I'm with my grandmother.和我祖母在一起时，我不得不特别注意自己的言谈举止。





mind, intellect, intelligence, brains, wit, wisdom

这些名词均有“智力，智慧”之意。
mind: 使用广泛，无褒贬之意。强调诸如认识、记忆、思考、决定等的智慧功能。
intellect: 侧重不受感情或意志左右的冷静思考或领悟能力。
intelligence: 指处理或对付问题或情况的特殊才智；也指运用、展开智慧的能力。
brain: (多用复数brains)强调理解能力和独立的或者首创性的思维能力。
wit: 指先天的才能、智力、意识等，隐含小聪明意味。
wisdom: 较文雅，也可指明智的言行。



care, mind

这组词都有“介意，在乎”的意思，其区别是：
care: 指对某事感到关切、操心或忧虑，主要用于否定句或疑问句。
mind: 通常用于否定句、疑问句或条件句中。也可用在答复询问的肯定句中。指因某事打扰、感到不满而表示反对。



intellect, wit, wisdom, mind, brain, intelligence

这组词都有“智力，智慧”的意思，其区别是：
intellect: 侧重不受感情或意志左右的冷静思考或领悟能力。
wit: 指先天的才能、智力、意识等，隐含小聪明意味。
wisdom: 较文雅，也可指明智的言行。
mind: 使用广泛，无褒贬之意。强调诸如认识、记忆、思考、决定等的智慧功能。
brain: (多用复数brains)强调理解能力和独立的或者首创性的思维能力。
intelligence: 指处理或对付问题或情况的特殊才智；也指运用、展开智慧的能力。



attend, remark, mind, notice, note

这组词都有“注意”的意思，其区别是：
attend: 一般用词，侧重专心于某事。
remark: 一般指经过思维活动而注意到。
mind: 指用心地去观察，了解某人或某物以达到某一目的。常用于命令句中。
notice: 指对所见所闻所感的人或事作出的反应，侧重结果。
note: 语气比notice强，指不仅注意到，而且记录下来，侧重注意的认真与仔细。


n. 理智，精神；意见； [心理] 智力；记忆力
 - opinion, intelligence, energy, memory, spirit
vt. 介意；专心于；照料
 - devote one's attention to, concentrate upon
vi. 介意；注意
 - take care of, take notice
examples: 英 [maɪnd] 美 [maɪnd]
n.头脑；精神；心；想法；意见；心思；注意力；有才智的人；记忆；心情；理智；[宗]追思弥撒；上帝v.留心；注意；专心于；介意；照顾

(1) He is ninety years old,but his mind is sharp.(2) Her death had an unbalancing effect on Joe's mind.(3) I tried to fix the date in my mind.(4) Despite what she says, I won't change my mind.(5) He changed his mind when he heard all the facts.(6) He focused his mind on his new plan.(7) Try and focus your mind on your lessons.(8) He is one of the greatest minds of the age.(9) You should keep in mind what I have said.(10) I can't think where I've left my umbrella; my mind's a complete blank!(11) She was in a cheerful frame of mind.(12) He was in a bad frame of mind this morning.(13) He unbent his mind by reading detective stories.(14) I lose my mind just standing next to her.(15) He was not the only prisoner to lose his mind.(16) Mind the dog! It may be fierce.(17) Only, mind you, good mowing requires some little skill.(18) Mind your own business!(19) Would you mind if I smoke here?(20) I don't mind the children's comings and goings.(21) My mother is minding the shop.

(1) 他虽然90岁了,但头脑还很灵活。(2) 她一死,乔在精神上打击很大。(3) 我试着把那个日期牢记在心。(4) 不管她怎么说,我都不会改变我的想法的。(5) 他得知事实后改变了看法。(6) 他集中心思在新计划上。(7) 试着把你的注意力集中在功课上。(8) 他是当代最有才智的人之一。(9) 我刚才说过的你要记住。(10) 我想不起来把伞丢在哪儿了，一点印象都没有！(11) 她心情愉快。(12) 今天上午他心情恶劣。(13) 他以读侦探小说来使他的心情松弛。(14) 站在她旁边我就意乱情迷。(15) 他不是唯一一个失去理智的囚犯。(16) 留神那条狗! 可能很凶。(17) 不过,你要注意,割草要割得好,也需要一点技巧。(18) 管好你自己的事！(19) 我在这吸烟，你介意吗？(20) 我并不介意孩子们进进出出。(21) 我母亲在照应店铺。
[sound:youdao-bb523daa-aad3e956-e4c0bfc8-5b7c0fe4-6a702051.mp3]

translation:
pron. (I的所有格)我的（东西）
n. 矿; 矿井; 地雷; 水雷
vt. & vi. 在…中开采，开采
vt. 在…中[下]布雷; 以地雷[水雷]炸毁

时态：mined, mining, mines


→来自me的所有格。mine 矿，矿山，地雷
pron.(I的物主代词)我的(东西)n.矿v.采矿Several severe federal generals drank the mineral water on the miner's funeral.好几个严厉的联邦将军在矿工的葬礼上喝了矿泉水.
【参】undermine（v 在下面挖矿；暗中破坏）



pronoun  ESSENTIAL  ■the one(s) belonging to or connected with me 我的（所有物）；属于我的（东西）；与我有关的（人）
•"Whose bag is this?" "It's mine."“这是谁的袋子？”“是我的。”

•Your son is the same age as mine.你儿子的年纪和我儿子一样大。

•She's an old friend of mine.她是我的一个老朋友。

[maɪn] noun countable HOLE  洞   ESSENTIAL  ■a hole or system of holes in the ground made for the removal of substances such as coal, metal, and salt by digging 矿，矿井
•a coal/salt/gold mine煤／盐／金矿

•a mine shaft矿井

•My grandfather used to work in/ UKdown the mines.我祖父以前在矿井里工作。

[maɪn] noun countable BOMB  炸弹   IMPROVER  ■a type of bomb put below the earth or in the sea which explodes when vehicles, ships or people go over it 地雷；水雷
•He was killed when his tank ran over a mine.他的坦克触到地雷，他被炸死了。

•The US forces were clearing the surrounding area of mines.美国部队正在清除周围地区的地雷。
⇒ See also landmine
[maɪn] noun countable a mine of information ■someone who has a lot of knowledge （指人）资讯宝藏，知识宝库
[maɪn] verb DIG  开采  intransitive or transitive ■to dig coal or another substance out of the ground 采，开采（煤等）
•They're mining for salt.他们正在采盐。

•They mine a lot of copper around these parts.他们在这里周围开采出许多铜。

[maɪn] verb BOMB  布雷  transitive often passive ■to place or hide mines in an area of land or sea 布雷于
•The desert was heavily mined.这片沙漠地雷密布。

[maɪn] verb mine a rich seam of sth literary ■to take advantage of a strong feeling or quality in a particular situation 利用（特殊情境下的强烈情感或素质）
•Polidori, the right-wing politician, is mining a rich seam of fear and prejudice.右翼政客波里杜利正在利用人们的强烈恐惧和偏见。

[maɪn] determiner old use ■used in the past instead of 'my' before nouns that begin with a vowel or h 一度用在以母音或h开头的名词前，代替my使用
•mine eyes我的眼睛

•mine host我的主人




n. 矿，矿藏；矿山，矿井；地雷，水雷
 - ore, pit
vt. 开采，采掘；在…布雷
 - exploit
examples: 英 [maɪn] 美 [maɪn]
pron.我的n.矿；地雷；矿藏v.采矿；用地雷炸

(1) He is a distant cousin of mine.(2) The mine was closed owing to exhaustion.(3) The ship's bow was blown off by a mine.(4) A good encyclopaedia is a mine of information.(5) The cruiser was mined, and sank in five minutes.
(1) 他是我的一位远房表亲。(2) 这个煤矿因矿源枯竭而被关闭。(3) 船头给一枚水雷炸掉了。(4) 一部好的百科全书是一座知识宝库。(5) 这艘巡洋舰触雷，五分钟后沉没了。

→来自mine,矿山，矿物。引申词义矿物质。mineral 矿物质
n.矿物,矿石a.矿物的,矿质的Several severe federal generals drank the mineral water on the miner's funeral.好几个严厉的联邦将军在矿工的葬礼上喝了矿泉水.
【记】源于：mine（n 矿）



noun SUBSTANCE  物质  countable ■a valuable or useful chemical substance which is formed naturally in the ground 矿物countable ■a chemical that your body needs to stay healthy （人体所需的）矿物质
•A healthy diet should supply all necessary vitamins and minerals.健康的饮食应该提供所有必要的维生素和矿物质。

•a mineral supplement补充的矿物质

['mɪn.ər.əl] noun DRINK  饮料  minerals [plural] UK old-fashioned ■cold sweet fizzy (= with bubbles) drinks without alcohol 无酒精而味甜的泡腾冷饮；汽水

(1) That is the minimum number necessary to complete the circuit.(2) The minimum wage is 4.25 dollars an hour.(3) Repairing your car will cost a minimum of 100 dollars.(4) The class needs a minimum of 6 pupils to continue.(5) Consolidate everything to the bare minimum.(6) And when I did, I tried to keep it to a minimum.

translation:
n. 最低限度; 最小量; 最低消费; [数]极小值
adj. 最低的; 最小的; 最少的

分布：最低限度(47%)，最少的(31%)，最小量(18%)，最低程度的(4%)


→来自拉丁语minimus,最小的，-um,中性格。引申词义最小值，最低限度。minimum 最小值，最低限度
最小量(minim+um)[mini-表示"小"]
n.最小值,最低限度a.最小的,最低的The maximum plus or minus the minimum makes minute difference.最大值加上或者减去最小值只产生极小的差异.



['mɪn.ɪ.məm] (written abbreviation min.) noun countable usually singular (plural minimums or specialized  minima) ESSENTIAL  ■the smallest amount or number allowed or possible 最小值；最少量；最低限度
•Wage increases are being kept to a minimum because of the recession.由于经济衰退，工资增长的幅度被保持在最低水准。

•She hoped that her fiftieth birthday would pass with the minimum of fuss.她希望她的50岁生日能尽量安安静静地度过。

•We need a minimum of ten people to play this game.玩这个游戏我们至少需要十个人。
 Opposite maximum
['mɪn.ɪ.məm] (written abbreviation min.) adjective  ESSENTIAL  ■describes something that is the smallest or least allowed or possible 最低的，最小的，最低限度的
•This certificate is the minimum qualification required to teach English in most language schools.大多数语言学校都把这张证书定为入职英语教师必需具备的最低学历资格。

•Eighteen is the minimum age for entering most nightclubs.大多数夜总会只招待18岁或以上的人士。

['mɪn.ɪ.məm] (written abbreviation min.) adverb  ADVANCED  ■at the least 至少
•She reckons that you should do three exercise classes a week minimum to get any of the benefits.她认为你应该每周参加至少三次健身课程才能有点锻炼效果。

 - lowest, least, smallest

translation:
adj. 较小的，少数的，小…; 未成年的; [乐]小调的，小音阶的; （两同姓男孩中）年幼的
n. 未成年人; 副修科目; 小公司; [逻辑学]小前提
vi. [主美国英语]副修，选修，兼修

分布：未成年人(32%)，次要的(20%)，较小的(17%)，轻微的(16%)，辅修(12%)，辅修科目(3%)


→来自拉丁语minor,较小的，次等的，来自mei,小的，词源同minute,minus.-or,比较级后缀。minor 较小的，较少的，次要的
较小的;较少的(min+or)[mini,min=small,表示"小"]
a.较小的,较小的n.兼修学科v.(in)兼修No minors.未成年者免入.



US [-nɚ] adjective UNIMPORTANT  不重要的   IMPROVER  ■having little importance, influence or effect, especially when compared with other things of the same type 较不重要的；次要的；轻微的
•a minor operation小手术

•It's only a minor problem.那只是个小问题。

•There's been an increase in minor offences , such as traffic violations and petty theft.轻微的违法活动有所增加，如违反交通规则、小偷小摸等。

•She suffered only minor injuries.她只是受了轻伤。

•It requires a few minor adjustments.需要作几处小的调整。

•a minor poet of the 16th-century16世纪一位不太知名的诗人
 Compare major
UK ['maɪ.nər] US [-nɚ] adjective MUSIC  音乐  ■belonging or relating to a type of musical scale that generally has a sad sound, typically having a half tone between the second and third and between the fifth and sixth notes, and a whole tone between each of the others 小调的；小音阶的
•The piece is written in a minor key.这是一首用小调谱写的乐曲。

•Mozart's Piano Concerto No. 20 in D minor.莫札特的第20号D小调钢琴协奏曲
 Compare major
UK ['maɪ.nər] US [-nɚ] noun countable legal ■someone who is too young to have the legal responsibilities of an adult 未成年人
•He was accused of having sex with a minor.他被指控与一名未成年人发生性关系。





minor, inferior, secondary, subordinate

这组词都有“次等”的意思，其区别是：
minor: a较少的，较小的，较次要的，常含有轻微的但并非不重要的意思。
 • We agreed on everything in the contract, even minor points.   我们对合同中的一切问题，甚至是细枝末节都达成了一致。
inferior: a.次等的，较劣的，差的，当"下级"讲时，强调职位的高低；当"次等"讲时，指素质、质量等的低劣。
 • Most wine from Switzerland is inferior to wine from France.   产于瑞士的葡萄酒多数要比法国的差。
secondary: a.第二等的，次要的，强调在重要性或顺序上处于第二位。
 • My job is of secondary importance to my health.   我的工作比起身体来说不那么重要。
subordinate: a.次要的，从属的，下级的，强调主次地位或支配和隶属的关系。
 • He was always friendly to his subordinate officers.   她对下级官员一向和蔼可亲。



minor, negligible, minimal, marginal

这组词都有“不重要的，次要的”的意思，其区别是：
minor: 多指与别的比较后显得不重要，或指较少、较小。
negligible: 指数量小，不重要，微不足道或可忽略不计。
minimal: 指最少、最低或最小。
marginal: 指处于边缘，幅度、范围小，故价值或重要性不大。


adj. 未成年的；次要的；较小的；小调的；二流的
 - secondary, supporting, peripheral, less
n. 未成年人；小调；副修科目
 - infant, pupil
examples: 英 ['maɪnə(r)] 美 ['maɪnər]
adj.轻微的；较小的；次要的n.未成年人；辅修科目；[音]小调v.辅修

(1) You should be thankful that you have escaped with only minor injuries.(2) We can only make minor concessions, but it might break the deadlock.(3) She played a minor role in the movie.(4) It is illegal to sell cigarettes to minors.(5) My major is English, but I also have a minor in psychology.(6) He played the key of C minor beautifully.
(1) 你应该感到庆幸,你只是受了点轻伤,但是却脱险了。(2) 我们只能做些较小的让步，但这就可能打破僵局。(3) 她在电影中扮演了一个次要的角色。(4) 向未成年人出售香烟是违法的。(5) 我主修英语,还辅修心理学。(6) 他优美地演奏了C小调。

translation:
n. 少数; 少数民族; 未成年

分布：少数(70%)，少数民族(28%)，未成年(2%)


→来自minor,较小的，较少的，-ity,名词后缀。引申词义少数派，少数民族。minority 少数派，少数民族
少数;未成年(minor小或少+ity→少的状态→少数)[mini,min=small,表示"小"]
n.少数,少数派,少数民族The minority of us are confronted with difficulty in the frontier of the major.我们少数人在该专业尖端领域面临困难.



US [-'nɑ:r.ə.tˌi] noun SMALL PART  小部分   IMPROVER  only singular ■a smaller number or part 少数
•It's only a tiny minority of people who are causing the problem.惹麻烦的只是极少数的人。

•Children with single parents at my school were very much in the minority (= there were very few).在我的学校里单亲孩子只占极少数。

•This section of the bookstore caters for minority interests (= subjects that interest only a few people).书店的这个专柜主要满足少数读者的兴趣。
 Opposite majority
UK [maɪ'nɒr.ɪ.ti] US [-'nɑ:r.ə.tˌi] noun PEOPLE  人   IMPROVER  countable ■any small group in society that is different from the rest because of their race, religion or political beliefs, or a person who belongs to such a group 少数民族；少数派；少数民族人士；少数派人士
•ethnic/religious minorities少数民族／宗教少数派

•The plan was designed to help women and minorities overcome discrimination in the workplace.这项计划旨在帮助女性和少数群体克服在工作场所受到的歧视。

UK [maɪ'nɒr.ɪ.ti] US [-'nɑ:r.ə.tˌi] noun be in a minority of one ■to be the only person who has your opinion 是唯一持不同意见者；得不到任何人的支持

(1) Only a minority of British households do not have a car.(2) A small minority voted against the motion.(3) The question of which state the minority group should belong to was decided by (a) plebiscite.(4) There are 56 minorities in our country.(5) The nationality of the minority groups in that country is still at issue.
(1) 英国只有少数家庭没有汽车。(2) 投票反对该提议的人占少数。(3) 该少数民族应归属哪一州的问题已由公民投票表决。(4) 我国有56个少数民族。(5) 在那个国家的少数民族的国籍问题上仍有争论。

translation:
prep. （表示否定）没有; 缺少; （表示运算）减去; （表示数目）在零度以下
n. 减号; 负号; 不利; 不足
adj. 负的; 不利的; 略低于某标准的

分布：减去(65%)，减号(19%)，负的(7%)，负数(5%)，减的(2%)，缺点(2%)


→来自拉丁语minus,较小的，较少的，来自minor的中性格，词源同minute,minimum.后引申词义减号，负值。
减去(min+us→变少→减去)[mini,min=small,表示"小"]
a.负的,减的prep.减去n.负号,减号The maximum plus or minus the minimum makes minute difference.最大值加上或者减去最小值只产生极小的差异.



preposition  ADVANCED  ■reduced by a stated number 减（去）
•What is 57 minus 39?57减39是多少？

•That will be £1500, minus the deposit of £150 that you have already paid.减去你已付的150英镑的订金，那就是1500英镑。
 Compare plus informal ■without; lacking  没有，缺少
•We're minus a chair for Ian - could you get one from the other room?我们没有椅子给伊恩坐了——你能从另一个房间拿一张过来吗？

['maɪ.nəs] noun countable (plural minuses)DISADVANTAGE  不利  ■a disadvantage or a bad feature 缺点；不利条件
•Having to travel such a long way to work is a definite minus.上班的路程这么远无疑是一个不利之处。

['maɪ.nəs] noun countable (plural minuses)SUBTRACTION  减少  (also minus sign) ■the - sign, written between two numbers to show that the second number should be subtracted from the first, or in front of one number to show that it has a value of less than 0 减号；负号
['maɪ.nəs] adjective SUBTRACTION  减少  [before noun] ■A minus number or amount is less than zero. （数字）负的⇒ See also negative[before noun] ■used to show that temperatures are less than zero 零下的
•Temperatures could fall to minus eight tonight.今晚气温可能会下降到零下八度。
[after noun] ■used after a mark given to written work to mean that it is of a slightly lower standard than that mark 略差一些的，稍差的
•I got A minus for my English homework.我的英语作业得了 A-。

['maɪ.nəs] adjective DISADVANTAGE  不利  [before noun] ■describes a disadvantage or bad point 不利的；不好的
•One of the minus points of working at home is not having social contact with colleagues.在家工作的一个缺点是欠缺和同事的交往。




prep. [数] 减，减去
 - less
n. [数] 负号，减号；不足；负数
 - shortage, short of, lack, insufficient
adj. 减的；负的
 - negative, nonpositive

(1) The temperature is minus twenty degrees.(2) He seems to have mistaken a plus for a minus.(3) He calculated his gains and losses of money and the result was a minus.(4) Let's consider the pluses and minuses of moving house.(5) Seven minus three equals four.
(1) 温度是零下二十度。(2) 他似乎把正号误作负号了。(3) 他计算了收益和亏损, 所得结果是个负数。(4) 咱们考虑一下搬家的利弊吧。(5) 七减三等于四。
